direction.raw_text: fill the SCREEN. Then: the gentle voice of an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: barely more than a whisper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I am a common woman. I was born in a common cottage in a common village. My life would likely be no different from yours, were it not for the most uncommon events that occurred during the winter of the Year of Our Lord Thirteen Hundred and Twenty-five. I learned many things that winter. About people. About love. But mainly, I learned about loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tosses a piece of wood into the flames, which turns out to be a LARGE CAMPFIRE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) To this day, I am the only person that I know to be living who knows the whole truth about that horrible time. This is my tale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: revealing THREE KNIGHTS, beleaguered, scarred, returning from the Crusades. Their armor is in disarray, adorned with souvenirs from the Middle East. They're camped in a clearing, their cart pulled to a nearby roadside. LIGHTNING flashes in the distance. One of them, a TEENAGE BOY who looks like his sword might weigh more than he does, hitches a nervous HORSE to a tree. He strokes the horse's neck, calming. Then: A WOLF HOWLS in the distance. The Boy suddenly looks nervous, too. He quickly joins the others at the campfire -- a FAT KNIGHT (30s) and an OLD KNIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear what? The wolf HOWLS AGAIN. The Boy shivers, fearful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The innkeeper told me -- (CONTINUED) 2.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what he told you. He told you about the Wolf. The Beast of Villiers la CroisAe. (off Boy's look) The people of that village have been spreading that nonsense since before you were a tickle in your daddy's prick. I'd give you a whipping for believing it if I thought it would do any good. The Old Knight stares into the fire, then speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to travel these woods. They told the same stories then that they do now. Only I heard them from a man who actually saw the beast with his own eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half the people in these parts claim to have seen it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man claimed it was the last thing he ever saw. The Wolf took his eyes. And half his face. (off their looks) I saw his scars and empty eye sockets. His skin looked like it was on inside-out. It didn't seem to me like the kind of thing a man would make up a story about. He shrugs. His companions exchange an unnerved look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's raining now. The Knights sleep underneath the cart for shelter. Lightning FLASHES. Then, from O.S., the horse gives a series of frightened
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Boy stirs, but by the time he awakens, there is only the sound of the RAIN. Did he imagine it? He reluctantly decides to venture out to investigate. The Boy hurries over to where he tied the horse... but all he finds is the empty rope blowing in the wind. In a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of lightning, he sees that the horse is gone. Then he hears something. A strange GNAWING sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and POPPING. He slowly turns... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not far away, he makes out a shape in the darkness. The horse is on its side, WHEEZING helplessly. And there's something crouched next to it. We can't make out what it is, only a MAN-LIKE SHAPE, shrouded in shadow. Whatever it is, it's eating the horse alive. The Boy steps away in horror, then hurriedly stumbles back to his companions and frantically shakes them awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the devil are you --?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, wait! Be quiet! He raises a hand. He's heard something. They listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Approaching through the mud. The Boy's hand clutches a dagger, but the Fat Knight reaches out and stays him, terrified. The Boy follows his look. We never get a good look at THE FIGURE walking toward them. But what the men see scares them shitless. It stops near the cart. The men huddle together, watching as it slowly starts to walk around the cart -- -- then suddenly jumps atop it. The Figure is now above them. With each step it takes, the boards of the wooden cart CREAK and bend under its weight. A long beat. Then the Figure jumps down again, landing behind the men, startling them. It pauses. The men cower, shivering... Suddenly, the cart is flipped over as if it weighed nothing, revealing the terrified Knights beneath it. Lightning FLASHES. A shadow falls over them. The men scramble to their feet, but the Old Knight slips in the mud. The Boy stops to help him, but then the Old Knight starts screaming, something GROWLS, and the Boy stops short at what he sees. The Fat Knight runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! We have to help him! The Fat Knight ignores him. The Old Knight shrieks. We hear the same TEARING and POPPING that this thing made while eating the horse. The Boy quickly looks around... ... sees a curved Arabian scimitar lying in the mud, fallen from the overturned wagon. He grabs it and as the Fat Knight runs, the Boy stands his ground. He hefts the blade. He's young, but he has used this before. A lot. Rain beats down on his face and lightning FLASHES as he confronts the thing that is devouring the Old Knight. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Fat Knight runs through the forest without looking back. He hears a loud HOWL behind him and runs faster. Then he hears the Boy SCREAMING and blind panic sets in, his head filled with the sounds of his HEAVY BREATHING and RUNNING FOOTFALLS in the mud and crashing THUNDER. He's running so fast he nearly falls into the RUSHING RIVER that crosses his path. He quickly looks for a way to cross. The river is gorged and the water is moving fast. Then, in a flash of lightning, he spots it -- A fallen tree spans the river. The Knight hurries to it. The bark is smooth and slick from the rain. He can't stand on it. He has to crawl. He edges out on his hands and knees, his eyes flicking nervously at the waters surging underneath him. He has almost made it across... ... when he hears a LOW SNARL. He freezes. Looks back. Lightning FLASHES. The Figure, still obscured to us, stands on the riverbank behind the Knight. It GROWLS. The Knight tries to crawl away, but slips and nearly falls in the river. Then suddenly, the tree beneath him begins to move. He hangs on for his life and looks back. The Figure is on the tree behind him, slowly closing in. He starts to crawl, slips again. No way he can get away. He looks down into the racing river waters. Then back at the Figure closing in. The choice is clear. The Fat Knight dives headfirst off the tree -- -- but he never hits the water. Something grabs him by the legs and stops him short. He cries out and looks up at the thing that is dangling him helplessly above the water. He weeps. Then, abruptly -- -- he is yanked up out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: quickly and expertly cuts the throat of a pig that has been hung upside down by its hind legs. It kicks and squirms as it bleeds out into a pan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bustle along a muddy road. A MERCHANT sells his wares. Dogs run and BARK. A DISHEVELLED MAN locked up in the stockade. A BLACKSMITH's hammer CLANGS. On the surface, a typical medieval village. But something is wrong here. A pall hangs over the place. The people are subdued, beaten. A TITLE comes up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a SIGN in the village green. Hanging from it is a wood plank with a crude drawing of a moon on it, three- quarters full. The moon has a vaguely sinister face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tiny spider spins its web. CAMERA RACKS FOCUS to a pretty 17-year-old GIRL gazing up at it. Her name is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She scoops the spider up, watches it crawl around on her hand, fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The home of a medieval peasant. Isabelle's mother,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (late 30s), and sister, LUCIE (18, plain- looking), work in the garden. They look up as Isabelle emerges from the cottage, daintily carrying the spider.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly, Isabelle. Just kill it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't. It's the fifth commandment. Thou shalt not kill. Lucie rolls her eyes. Isabelle crouches, letting the spider crawl off her hand. She watches it skitter away, then calls to Suzette, feigning nonchalance:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to take Father some water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Don't be long. Isabelle smiles, grabs a bucket and ladle, and anxiously heads toward the village. Lucie watches her go, dubious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle struggles to draw water from a well. Even toiling and sweaty, Isabelle's beauty stands in stark contrast to her squalid surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: building a timber-framed structure notices his TWO YOUNG APPRENTICES (late teens) casting distracted glances in her direction. He calls out to her, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, there! Let one of these young lads get that for you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can do it myself. The Carpenter smiles. Of course she can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The village WOODCUTTERS are chopping down trees and hauling away the lumber. A GROUP of them are in the midst of what looks like a serious conversation. Isabelle approaches them with the bucket of water. One of them turns and sees Isabelle. His name is CESAIRE (handsome, 40s). He hides his dour expression and gives Isabelle a big smile. She smiles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother thought you might be thirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was very thoughtful of her. He gives her a knowing look as he ladles a drink from the bucket. Isabelle's gaze drifts from him to another woodcutter, working off by himself. His name is PETER (21, darkly handsome, almost dangerous-looking). He makes eye contact with Isabelle for a moment, then wipes his brow and calls out to the WOODCUTTER BOSS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking a break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A break? Does that mean you're going to start working? The other Woodcutters LAUGH. Peter walks away. Isabelle's gaze lingers on him too long. Cesaire notices, not entirely comfortable with what he sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not far from where the Woodcutters work, Peter waits, impatient. Soon Isabelle approaches, smiling. He takes her in his arms, kissing her. She holds him tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid you weren't coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should know better than that. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses her again, nibbling her neck. Isabelle opens her eyes, smiles up at him. Touches his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think my sister's starting to suspect something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think she'll tell your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. I wish she would tell him. I want everyone to know. Besides, my father likes you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course he does. Right up until the point where he figures out what I'm doing with his daughter. Peter glances back and Isabelle follows his look. Through the trees, she sees her father and the group of grim Woodcutters, still in serious conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't heard? (off her look) Three men. They found them this morning just off the Center Road. At least they think it was three men. There wasn't enough left to piece them back together. A long beat as Isabelle takes this in. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it the Wolf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could it have been anything else? Isabelle shudders. No, it couldn't have been.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should have killed that monster a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. You say that every month. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives her a grim smile, then kisses her. She kisses him back, then tries to stop kissing him. It's not easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd better go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same time tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get used to this. I start my sewing lessons next week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really think you can go all day without seeing me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll manage somehow. Pride is a cardinal sin, by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can think of worse sins I could be committing. She gives a cautioning look, then leaves with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The VILLAGE HERALD is changing the plank on the moon sign. He replaces the picture of the three-quarters moon with a picture of a half moon, its face indifferent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half full! Half full!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzette is putting bread and cheese into a basket. Isabelle pulls on a drab hooded cloak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind your grandmother, understand? You're her student now, the same as the other girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mother. Suzette hands her the basket with a proud look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My last baby has grown up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle watches a DEAF BOY perform simple sleight of hand magic tricks. His name is CLAUDE (14). She applauds his performance and hands him a coin. He makes it 'disappear,' then smiles big and runs away. A crazy old woman, LUCRECE, shoots Isabelle a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're only encouraging him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ages 16-18) approach: ROXANNE (round-faced, cheery and instantly likable), PRUDENCE (practical, serious), and ROSEMARIA (pretty, arrogant, flirtatious). A playful PUPPY tags along. Prudence and Rosemaria look tired, but Roxanne greets Isabelle with a big smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you excited?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too early to be excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just trying to look on the bright side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, stop it before somebody hurts you. The girls have a laugh at Roxanne's expense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls leave the village on a trail that leads through the dark forest. The puppy stops at the edge of the forest. Then it WHINES and refuses to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trail stretches out in front of the girls as far as they can see. Rosemaria walks with Roxanne. Prudence hangs back with Isabelle, brimming with juicy gossip. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear about her and the Darley brothers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no! Which one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both! On the same night! Isabelle gives an incredulous look and Prudence tries to contain her laughter. Rosemaria hears and looks back at them. She scowls at Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does your grandmother have to live so far away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, Rosemaria? Having trouble walking? Prudence laughs. Roxanne frowns, disapproving. Rosemaria shoots Isabelle a dirty look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls cross a little wooden bridge that spans a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: brook and follow the trail to a large cottage, well past its prime. Chickens CLUCK and peck around it. An OLD WOMAN opens the door and waves to them. She's stooped and withered, but her eyes are bright and beautiful. She wears a blue belted gown and a necklace with a crucifix on it. This is Isabelle's GRANDMOTHER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, stop dawdling. Come on, come on. The girls hurry inside, but Grandmother stops Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother has warned you not to expect any special treatment from me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am. Grandmother eyes her a moment longer, then breaks into a smile and surreptitiously hands her a bright red apple. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then your mother doesn't know me very well, does she? Isabelle smiles as Grandmother ushers her inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother works a pair of knitting needles, casting loops of red wool yarn onto one of them, a BLACK CAT resting on her lap. Her bedchamber is hidden by a beautiful veil embroidered with palms and pomegranates. The girls sit facing her, watching as she knits. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. This is going to be my foundation. Everything I do now will build off of this. She shows the row of stitches to Roxanne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne, is this a good foundation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... you haven't told us what you're making.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something else I haven't told you. I haven't told you why I'm making it. Before you begin any task, you must first always ask yourself why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? The girls laugh. Grandmother gives her a patient smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because understanding why you are doing something is the key to doing it successfully. So, before we begin today, let's be certain that we have a good foundation. Who can tell me why you are here? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To become seamstresses. To learn how to sew and mend clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you are doing. But why are you doing it? Blank looks. None of them have ever considered this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle, your sister studied with me last winter. What does she do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She works with the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you work with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how to yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how does that make you feel? Isabelle thinks for a moment, then has an insight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a child. Grandmother gives her a smile, then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be coming here every day for the next three months. During that time, I will teach you everything you need to know to be productive members of our community. But there is something far more important that will also be happening here. All the girls are paying close attention now, but Grandmother seems to be speaking directly to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be proving your worth and learning your place in the world. And I promise you, when you leave here for the last time, you will never feel like a child again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The four girls return to the village along the forest path. Waiting for them is Peter. Isabelle pretends to not notice him. As they pass, he calls out to her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to talk to you. Isabelle turns to face him, trying to stay nonchalant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about? Peter just looks at her for a beat. Isabelle turns and sees that the other girls have stopped to watch. Isabelle shoots them a look. The girls take the hint and leave. When they've gone, Peter walks up to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When were you planning on telling me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Telling you what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That you're engaged to be married to Henri Smith. Isabelle gapes at him, stunned and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri Smith? Is this a joke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me. Just look at me and tell me you didn't know. She looks at him and sees it in his eyes. He's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who told you this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father. Off Isabelle's look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family is gathered around the table. Isabelle and Lucie listen to their parents in stunned silence. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all been arranged. Your marriage to Henri will settle our debt to his father. Isabelle nods, shaken. Cesaire sees that she's upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know that you and Peter have become friends. But you have adult responsibilities now. That means putting your family's interests ahead of your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Henri Smith is in the family's interest and Peter is not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter is a fine young man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what? He's poor? He's an orphan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not one of us. His parents were outsiders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Because they hadn't lived here since Noah built the ark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind your tongue. Isabelle is about to respond, when she notices something. Lucie is crying. A beat. Lucie looks up at her parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you realize how this makes me look? I'm older than her by more than a year. If anyone should be getting married in the spring, it's me. Everyone is taken aback. Lucie storms out of the cottage, angrily wiping tears. Isabelle watches her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire smokes his pipe, troubled. Suzette sits nearby. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was your idea. Now I have both of them hating me. In the loft, Isabelle and Lucie are in bed... but Isabelle only pretends to be asleep so she can eavesdrop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We knew Isabelle was going to be stubborn. It wouldn't be like her to simply do as she's told. She's too much like her grandmother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That she is. What about Lucie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a good girl, but she's still a child. Talk to her. You're her father. She'll listen to you. Isabelle glances over at Lucie... and sees that she's been eavesdropping, too. Lucie turns away, embarrassed. Isabelle gives her a sad look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a knock at the door. Isabelle answers, revealing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's tall and good-looking, but still awkward in his body. Isabelle eyes him, a little aloof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Henri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Henri walk in awkward silence. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I suppose you've heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. My parents are very pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you? Are you pleased?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a very generous arrangement. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not the answer he was hoping for. Another awkward beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any other feelings about it? About me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure. We've never really talked that much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. That's why I asked you to walk with me. I wanted to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... because we're going to be husband and wife soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not until the spring festival. That's months away. A lot can happen in a few months. Henri seems disappointed. She sees this and reconsiders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. What would you like to talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not really sure. I brought you this. He reaches into his pocket and offers Isabelle a flower. She takes it, suddenly blushing. But just then, she sees Peter walking toward them with another WOODCUTTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm glad we had this conversation. Isabelle abruptly turns and walks away, leaving Henri surprised and a little hurt. She passes Peter, her eyes averted. He glances back at her as she and walks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is helping Suzette prepare dinner, but she's purposefully ignoring her mother. Suzette notices. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I had a sweetheart when I was your age, too. Isabelle looks up, intrigued in spite of herself. Suzette smiles slyly at her reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing happened. My parents arranged for me to marry your father and that was the end of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you want to marry your sweetheart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, I did. But there's more to marriage than being in love. Love doesn't always last and it certainly doesn't fill your children's bellies in the winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never wished you could have married that other boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even once. Isabelle eyes her, still uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle prays in front of an altar with prayer candles on it. Peter kneels next to her and lights one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Peter stand behind the church, out of sight. Peter looks off toward the woods, his back to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to go through with it. You have to marry Henri. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle takes a step toward him. She hesitates, gathering her nerve to speak. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what my parents want. They don't own me. I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does to me. Doesn't it matter to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not our decision to make.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sound like my mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then maybe you should start listening to your mother. (off her look) It's over. They had to find out eventually. Don't turn this into something that it's not. We had our fun, but that's all it ever was. Isabelle looks up at him, shocked and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go home, Isabelle. Go home and grow up. Isabelle gapes at him. Peter walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you! He doesn't look back. She watches him go, heartbroken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire bathes in a cold stream. The sun is just barely rising, rays of light shining through the trees. He smiles. It looks like the start of a beautiful day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The village is bustling with activity, but there's a palpable tension. The picture on the moon sign is of a three-quarters moon... but then the Herald changes it to a picture of a FULL MOON with a cruel, malevolent face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full moon! Full moon! Full moon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle emerges from the cottage. Roxanne, Prudence, and Rosemaria are outside waiting on her. They all start toward the village, but then Isabelle sees something... In the shadows next to the cottage, Cesaire is giving Lucie a stern lecture. Lucie turns and sees Isabelle. Her face is ashen and there are tears in her eyes. Isabelle starts toward them, but Cesaire stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This doesn't concern you, Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Father. Isabelle reluctantly turns and walks away. The girls follow her. Roxanne gives Lucie a concerned look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls walk through the village. Isabelle is lost in thought, stung by her father's brusk dismissal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with Lucie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you feel if you were in love with your sister's fiancAe? Isabelle stops short and gives Rosemaria a sharp look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie is not in love with my fiancAe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? So she's just had a crush on him since she was ten? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if she would really tell you something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't. She told my sister. (off Isabelle's look) Did you honestly not know? Isabelle clearly had no idea, but tries to hide it. Just then, they walk by the blacksmith's shop where Henri works with his father, ADRIEN. Henri smiles at Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. We're going to be late. She turns away. Rosemaria gives her a smug look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls are walking down the path to Grandmother's cottage. Rosemaria lags behind, tired and grumpy. There's a fork in the path and Rosemaria stops at it. A SMALLER PATH branches off into the forest, overgrown and narrow. Rosemaria looks at it for a beat... Roxanne suddenly notices that Rosemaria isn't with them. She looks back and sees her start down the other path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rosemaria...? The other girls stop and hurry back to the fork, dismayed to find Rosemaria headed down the overgrown path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't go that way. You have to stay on the path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way is faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's not safe. My brother says the bridge is rotten. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. It's bad enough working all day in that smelly cottage. It's not reasonable for them to expect us to walk that far every day on top of that. She walks away, defiant. The girls look nervous. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you get lost, nobody will come looking for you. Not tonight. This last part gives Rosemaria pause. She looks down the narrow path. It suddenly seems a little ominous. Grudgingly, she returns to the group. The other girls exchange quiet looks of relief. They continue on. The wind blows leaves across the abandoned path...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls are busy with sewing and knitting projects. Grandmother helps Roxanne at the spinning wheel. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone finish what you're working on. Your parents will be worried if you're not home before it starts to get dark. The girls begin packing up their work. Prudence sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish someone would just kill that stupid wolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just kill it. It's not an ordinary wolf. It's a devil- wolf. A servant of Satan himself. Prudence rolls her eyes. Whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who cares what it is? It's only one night a month. You stay inside, lock up the animals, and you don't go into the forest. It's never killed anyone from the village and as long as we leave it alone, it never will. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My goodness. I had no idea our young people were so woefully uneducated these days. (off their looks) Our village was not always like this. When I was young, this was a very special place. Traders and merchants came here from lands I'd never heard of selling things I had never seen. King Philip the Bold even visited here once. But that, of course, was before the Wolf came. The girls listen attentively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your parents fear the Wolf because they remember when it did kill people from the village. Break down doors in the middle of the night and snatch children right out of their beds. Rumors began to spread that we were cursed. That was when our village began to die. And that was why my husband led a group of men into the woods to kill the Wolf. But instead, it killed him. Isabelle reacts. She has never heard this story before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After that, people here didn't have much stomach to go hunting for it anymore. But something had changed. The Wolf stopped killing in the village. Even our livestock were usually safe as long as they were brought inside. So we decided it was safer to compromise. We gave the Wolf its one night a month, the night of the full moon, and it has left us alone ever since.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People still die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but nobody we know. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone knows what should be done. But it's not always easy to do what you know is right. Sometimes it's easier to settle for being safe. Isabelle frowns, unsatisfied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Villagers hurriedly bring their sheep and pigs into their homes. Doors are shut and barricaded. Cesaire is outside the family cottage, nailing the shutters closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle's family sits at the dinner table in silence. Cesaire sets mugs of beer out for everyone. Lucie numbly picks at her food, doesn't touch her beer. Isabelle works up her nerve to say something and turns to Suzette:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were right. About Peter. I was being childish. (BEAT) But I'm not going to marry Henri. Cesaire and Suzette stop eating. Suzette levels a cold look at Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll do as you're told. It's all been arranged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family gains the same no matter which one of us marries him. And I don't love Henri. Lucie does. Lucie looks up, surprised to be dragged into this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's right. It's not fair. I will gladly trade places with her. A beat. Then, without looking up, Lucie whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. Isabelle is stung, the smile wiped from her face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Just shut up and mind your own business. A tense beat. Isabelle looks away, hurt and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is fast asleep. Next to her, Lucie looks over at her. She's wide awake. She sneaks out of bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie carefully sneaks down from the loft and quietly puts on a RED RIDING HOOD. She accidently kicks a pan on the floor and puts a hand down to silence it. She listens to hear if anyone has awakened. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie slips out of the house. She shivers in the cold, pulls the riding hood around her. FULL MOON in the sky. The village looks deserted, a ghost town. Eerie, still, dark. The moon-sign swings in the breeze, CREAKING on its rusty hooks. Lucie hurries away toward the woods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie nervously walks along the road leading away from the village. She startles at every sound. She looks up. The full moon is visible in the sky above her through the skeletal branches of the dark trees... She comes to the overgrown path that the girls stopped at earlier. Lucie takes a deep breath and starts down it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie reaches an OLD ROPE BRIDGE. It spans a deep gully and a fast-moving river strewn with jagged rocks. Lucie gives the bridge a nervous look and starts across it... The boards CREAK loudly under her feet. The bridge sways in the wind. She carefully makes her way across, only breathing when she is safely on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie comes to a grassy meadow bathed with moonlight. She stands in the middle of it, next to a large rock, and looks all around. She's alone, cold and afraid. Then... ... she takes off her riding hood, folds it, and places it on the rock. She begins to disrobe, folding her dress and her undergarments and stacking them in a neat pile. Soon she's standing naked, her arms clutched around her breasts, shivering with cold. And fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from this lonely naked figure until the dark branches of the trees obscure her from view. Then, somewhere, a WOLF HOWLS in the night...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle wakes up, groggy. Lucie's bed is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children are playing, a BOY chasing several giggling
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: growling and waving his hands like claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the Wolf! I'm going to eat you up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the Girls runs into the meadow and sees something that makes her stop short. The other Children gather behind her, all frozen by what they see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are picking at a bloody carcass. All we can see of it is a human hand. A crow gnaws on one of the fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girls are at their lessons. Suddenly, there's an urgent KNOCK at the door. Everyone stops, surprised. Grandmother answers it. It's a YOUNG MAN, sweaty and out of breath from running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What on earth --? The Young Man glances at Isabelle. Something about the look in his eyes makes Isabelle go pale...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle hurries into the clearing with Roxanne, Prudence, and Rosemaria trailing behind her. A crowd has gathered. She pushes through it, then stop short. Lucie is dead. We don't see what's been done to her, but Roxanne turns away and vomits. Cesaire and Suzette are already here. He holds her as she cries on his shoulder. Isabelle just stares at Lucie's body, shattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is curled in a fetal ball on the bed, clutching Lucie's cloak to her chest. She's cried her eyes out. Grandmother sets down a cup of tea. As Isabelle watches, Grandmother sprinkles a pinch of dark herbs in the tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my little secret. A pinch will help you rest. A little more and you'll sleep through the end of the world. Grandmother smiles. Isabelle smiles back, weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'd like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two men, the Merchant and the REEVE, gossip by the well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She had it coming, if you ask me. What the hell was she doing out there? Then they notice that Isabelle is right behind them, drawing a water from the well. Both men shift uncomfortably, but she pretends she didn't hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie's body lies on the table. Isabelle watches as Suzette and Grandmother bathe the body. Suddenly, Grandmother stops. She's found something clutched in Lucie's hand. A troubled look comes over her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Grandmother curtly wraps what she's found in a washcloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie's funeral. Cesaire and Suzette sit with Isabelle, who holds Grandmother's hand. The other girls are here, too. Roxanne sits with her mother, MARGUERITE, and Claude, the deaf boy we saw performing magic. The priest, FATHER AUGUSTE, conducts the service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wherefore each man and woman that is wise, make him ready thereto; for we all shall die, and we know not how soon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Villagers leave the church. Claude is playing in the cemetery. Father Auguste frowns, disapproving. Marguerite sees this and angrily pulls Roxanne aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your brother home. Embarrassed, Roxanne quickly grabs Claude and drags him away, but he fights her, crying and kicking. Isabelle's family is met by Henri and his father, Adrien.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was a good girl. We all loved her. He's looking at Cesaire and shakes his hand, but he briefly glances at Suzette. Isabelle notices the look, but then she spots Peter leaving the church. She makes brief eye contact with him before Henri interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here for you, too. But her gaze follows Peter as he walks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the town bailiff, presides over a gathering of the Villagers. Isabelle, Suzette, and Grandmother sit with Cesaire, who is angrily addressing the crowded room. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A line has been crossed. The beast must be destroyed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your daughter crossed the line. She went into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was taken. She must have been!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the Wolf broke into your home and stole your daughter without waking anyone or leaving any sign at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been almost thirty years since someone here was killed by the Wolf. We've left it alone. Why would it suddenly come and take one of us now? Grandmother gathers her nerve and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know something. Cesaire and Suzette give Grandmother surprised looks. She walks up to the table and hands Attewater the wadded up washcloth we saw her with earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found this. I believe it must belong to her attacker. Attewater unfolds the washcloth. There are a few strands of hair inside. He gives her a sharp look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not animal hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it isn't. It's human. A stunned silence comes over the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No man could have done the things that were done to your granddaughter. It must have been the Wolf. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet she was holding a man's hair in her hand when she died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you suggesting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That the man and the Wolf may be one and the same. A low MURMUR works its way through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A werewolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would explain much. The Pope himself has declared that such creatures exist. The thought gives everyone pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if you're right, it doesn't help us. The woods are filled with hermits and strangers. If there's a werewolf among them, how will we find it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are experts in these matters. Men who find and try witches and werewolves. We could request the Church to send someone. Grandmother gives him a sharp look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not someone. You're talking about Father Solomon. This sends a ripple of comment through the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is the Church's most successful werewolf hunter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what of his methods? The man once burned down an entire village just to root out one witch. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unsubstantiated rumors. The Church has appointed him the Witchfinder General of all Christendom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is also unsubstantiated. Attewater eyes him, but Father Auguste stands his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have the utmost confidence in the ability of the Witchfinder General to determine the nature of the beast and put an end to it. I will dispatch a messenger in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if Father Solomon agrees to help us, it will take weeks for him to get here. That means another full moon. Maybe two. We must defend ourselves. A long, silent beat. Then, Henri stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. The beast broke the peace, not us. (TO CESAIRE) I will help you kill it. Henri's father gives him a surprised look. But after another long beat, the Reeve stands up, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As will I. We all will. Henri is nervous, but tries to appear brave for Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is about to leave when she sees Lucie's red riding hood. She gives it a solemn look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light snow has fallen. The girls are walking to Grandmother's house, but Isabelle sadly lags behind, lost in thought. She's wearing Lucie's red riding hood. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne waits for Isabelle and offers her hand. Isabelle smiles sadly and takes it. Prudence and Rosemaria let them catch up, then they continue on together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle returns home. Suzette is making dinner, but stops short when she sees Isabelle in Lucie's red cloak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who gave you permission to wear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody. I just -- SUZETTE Your Grandmother made that for Lucie. Take it off. Isabelle hesitates, then does as she's told. Suzette snatches the cloak away from her. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was folded when they found her. Her clothes, too. Did you notice that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone must have folded them. A beat. Isabelle is reluctant to voice her thoughts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was so unhappy. Suzette turns, her eyes narrowing dangerously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she went into the woods on purpose. Maybe she wanted to die. Suddenly: Suzette slaps her across the face. Hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie's soul is at peace with God. Don't you ever again suggest otherwise. Suzette turns away in tears. Isabelle is stunned speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle trudges through the mud toward a ramshackle cottage. If there had been train tracks in the fourteenth century, this place would have been on the wrong side of them. Isabelle gathers her nerve and knocks on the door. A long beat. The door opens. It's Peter. He gives her a surprised look. She looks up at him, choking back tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I just need to talk to someone. Can I come in? Peter balks. Just then, a figure appears. Isabelle can't believe her eyes... It's Rosemaria. She's standing behind Peter, but it's clear that she's naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You can't. She wraps an arm around Peter's waist. Isabelle gives him a stricken look and runs away. Peter watches her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lessons are over. The girls are ready to leave except for Isabelle, who sits alone by the fire. Rosemaria gives her a sly look as she leaves. When the girls have gone, Grandmother sits down next to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate the cold. Why can't we have lessons in the summer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose that would be easier. But then that would defeat the purpose. People only change when things are difficult. Isabelle gives her a look, understanding, then turns away. Grandmother puts a hand on her shoulder and then leaves her alone. Isabelle stares into the fire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne comes home to a shocking scene: her mother, Marguerite, half-naked and wrapped in a blanket, (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: viciously beating Claude with a switch. Roxanne hurriedly pulls her off of him and he runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I caught the little bastard watching us!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching what? Just then, the Merchant enters from the bedroom, adjusting his clothes. He hesitates when he sees Roxanne, then drops a handful of coins on the table and leaves. Marguerite puts the coins in a leather purse. Roxanne glares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's money, isn't it? You could make twice this your first time. They pay more for virgins. Roxanne recoils in disgust and storms out in tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The full moon sign swings in the wind, a few flakes of snow whipping through the air around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adrien picks up a hammer and a pickaxe. He hands the hammer to Henri, fixing him with a serious look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do this for Isabelle. She can't marry you if you're dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not doing it for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother would be proud to see the man you've become. Henri is moved. He nods, at a loss for words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so much a tavern as the home of someone who decided to brew some beer and sell it. Cesaire stands before a group of men. They've all had too much to drink. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father died trying to kill the Wolf. For forty years, we have lived in fear of it. But no more. And never again. We don't need a Witchfinder General to rid of us this hell-hated beast. Because by God and all that is holy, the Beast of Villiers la CroisAe shall die tonight! The men CHEER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire leads the drunken group through the streets. The rest of the Villagers line the streets, watching them go. Claude tries to join the hunters, thinking it's a game, but Roxanne quickly catches him. Peter shakes his head at the dubious spectacle. Henri sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not coming with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you joking? These fools are as likely to kill each other as they are anything else. Henri shoots him an angry look before moving on. Isabelle and Suzette say goodbye to Cesaire. Isabelle sees Peter through the crowd and quickly looks away. Just then, Henri and Adrien pass by. On impulse, Isabelle runs up and kisses Henri on the mouth. When she's sure that Peter has seen this, she quickly walks away. Henri gives Peter a gloating look. Peter scowls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Men have taken up positions just inside the treeline, one of them every twenty feet, surrounding the village. They each have lit torches. CAMERA FINDS Henri crouched in the brush. Cesaire walks along the line of men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that torch out. Henri douses his torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The full moon is high in the night sky. Snow is falling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: over the anxious face of the hunters. Adrien, clutching his pickaxe. The Reeve. The Merchant. The Carpenter. Shivering from cold and jangled nerves, staring wide-eyed into the dark and silent woods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle lies in bed, but still awake. Suddenly... a wolf HOWLS outside. Her eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Reeve hears it. He clutches an old sword. Nearby, the Merchant cowers in the brush. Adrien listens as the wolf HOWLS over and over, louder each time. The Carpenter nervously peers out from his cover...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The HOWLING is getting closer. Isabelle goes to the window, opens the shutter, cautiously peers out... and is startled by a HORRIBLE SCREAM in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Carpenter hears the SCREAM, too. He runs toward it and finds an extinguished torch on the ground. There are footprints in the snow. And blood. The brush around him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and he jumps to his feet, axe held at the ready -- -- but it's just the other Men, led by the Reeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that screaming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. He's gone pale. The others follow his look. There's a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the snow. The Men stare at it. Suddenly, the same SCREAM pierces the night, this time coming from deeper in the woods. The Men exchange a wary look, but then start after it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They run into a still clearing where the snow-covered brush is as high as their waists. They pause and listen. Only silence. They carefully make their way in the direction of the screams, quiet. Frost-brittle leaves
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: under their feet... Suddenly -- something is moving in the brush. All they can see is the snowy brush violently shaking as it darts off, almost faster than it can be followed with the eye. It races right by the Merchant, knocking him on his ass, but it's gone before he can get a look at it. He startles as the Reeve pulls him to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way did it go? The Merchant points a trembling finger. The Reeve plunges into the brush after it and the Men follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Reeve leads the Men to the foot of a steep and rocky hill. It's a dead end. But then they hear the SCREAMS again. The Men look up at the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The caves. It's in the caves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Men stand in the mouth of a wide cave, relighting their torches. The SCREAMING echoes from inside. The Carpenter raises his torch. The cave is as deep and dark as a monster's throat. The Men crowd start inside... The SCREAMING continues, unnerving the Men as they approach. Then they come to a fork in the tunnel. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bounce off the stone walls. Impossible to tell where it's coming from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Split up. Two groups. Half the Men take one fork, half the other. We follow the Reeve's group down a narrowing passageway. The Men crowd together, hunched low. The SCREAMS seem to be getting louder. The Reeve stops, listening. He turns toward a low crack in the cave wall. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are coming from inside. He shines his torch inside, lowers his head, and walks toward it. The cave (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: floor takes a steep dip. He has to keep one hand on the wall to keep from falling... Then suddenly, his feet skid on a patch of loose pebbles and he loses his footing. He slides down the steep floor, drops his torch, hands flailing, unable to stop himself, and then -- -- he finds himself falling off a low cliff into the darkness. He tumbles head over heels down a rocky slope and splashes hard in a shallow underground river. The torch rolls off the ledge above and falls on the shore amidst a shower of grit and pebbles. The Reeve gets up, grimacing in pain, grabs the torch. He shines it around... and sees Adrien. He's leaning against a rock, the ground beneath him wet with blood spreading from a dark wound between his legs. Reeve rushes to his side and crosses himself when he sees the wound. Then: a low, menacing, GROWL. He turns... There's a huge, SNARLING GRAY WOLF behind him. Adrien's pickaxe juts from between its shoulder blades. Reeve freezes, suddenly realizing that he's dropped his sword. He splashes around in the river, blindly feeling for it in the water. The wounded animal growls, blood bubbling from between its teeth. Reeve finds the sword -- -- just as the wolf attacks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. The sun is starting to light the sky, revealing a peacefully glistening blanket of snow on the village. The Men are returning from the woods. Isabelle and Suzette are among the Villagers breathlessly awaiting them. No way of telling whether they met with success or failure. But as they near... ... we can see Reeve leading the group, carrying a pike with the wolf's severed head on it. The Villagers CHEER, but the Men are weary and subdued. Suzette and Isabelle find Cesaire. He hugs them tight. Suddenly, a woman GASPS. Then they see: the Men are carrying Adrien's body on a travois. Suzette chokes back her reaction. Henri walks with the body, eyes red and cried out. He passes Isabelle without looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri hammers at a red-hot iron horseshoe. Isabelle enters. Henri doesn't seem to notice. A hesitant beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard your father wounded the beast. He was a brave man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear what it did to him? It chewed off his private parts. Isabelle had not heard this. Henri doesn't stop working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I did nothing. I was too scared. I couldn't move. I just let my father be eaten alive. She moves toward him, but he shrugs her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't want you here. Isabelle gives him a sad look, then leaves. Henri just keeps hammering away on the anvil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A coffin is lowered into a grave. Father Auguste blesses it. Henri stands at his side. Isabelle is here with Roxanne. Lucrece eyes Isabelle, then whispers to her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought your mother would be here. They used to be quite close. Isabelle gives her a sharp look, but Lucrece says nothing more. Isabelle looks down at the coffin with a sudden realization...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzette is soaking clothes in a bucket of lye, crying as she works. Isabelle approaches. Suzette quickly wipes her eyes. A beat. Isabelle gathers her nerve, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me you had a sweetheart before you were married. It was Henri's father, wasn't it? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suzette freezes. She faces Isabelle, but doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie was in love with Henri. She could have married him. (off Suzette's look) Couldn't she have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We arranged for you to marry him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you gained the same no matter which one of us married him. So why did it have to be me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you know the answer to that question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You say it. Suzette's eyes well up. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie was Henri's half-sister. She was not your father's daughter. Isabelle suddenly looks ill. Reluctant, she asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I? Do you even know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I was already pregnant when your father and I married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. And he must never know. Tears spill down Isabelle's cheeks. She walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle! (BEAT) Promise me you won't tell him. Isabelle gives her a look that doesn't promise much. She leaves without answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother ladles soup into a bowl and brings it to Isabelle. Isabelle's eyes are red from crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've found that there's no burden that doesn't at least seem a little lighter on a full stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to do. She wants me to pretend like I don't know. How am I supposed to go on living in that house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a right to be angry with her. But try not to hate her. Too much hate will eat you alive. Isabelle nods and rests her head on Grandmother's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Isabelle enters the village, she hears LAUGHING and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Every cottage in the village is dark. Except one. Isabelle gathers her nerve and turns toward it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle tentatively enters. There aren't many people here, just Marguerite and a few ROWDY MEN making a lot of noise. Isabelle instantly sees what she's here for: Cesaire is slumped in a corner, drunk and passed out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle steers Cesaire through the doorway and drops him into the bed next to Suzette. He's already half-asleep. Suzette gives Isabelle a silent look, then turns away. Isabelle sighs. She sits next to Cesaire and kisses his forehead. As she stands, he clumsily takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a good girl. Isabelle allows a sad smile, places his hand back on his chest, and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wolf's head has been placed atop a stake. Children throw rocks at it. Isabelle watches with Roxanne and Prudence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard there's going to be a festival on the night of the next full moon. To celebrate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A festival? I've never been to one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father says he hasn't seen one since he was a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's strange, isn't it? You think because things have been a certain way your whole life that they'll always be the same. Then overnight everything just changes. But Isabelle is distracted. Amidst the morning bustle, she sees Rosemaria laughing with Peter. Roxanne notices. Just then, they hear HORSES approaching. A lot of them. Everyone stops what they're doing, listening, suddenly apprehensive. The girls turn toward the sound and see... ... A DOZEN SOLDIERS in identical armor, silver helmets gleaming in the sun, riding into the square atop armored steeds. The Villagers gape at them in awe. The Soldiers ride escort to a WHITE COACH with a red cross on it, drawn by two horses: one white, one black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides inside, cloaked in darkness. Isabelle gives it an uneasy look. Leading the Soldiers is the CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD, his helmet adorned with a blood-red plume. He brings the caravan to a halt in front of the Merchant's shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Villiers la CroisAe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, my lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Summon your bailiff. My master would speak with him at once. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, my lord. May I ask to what does he owe this honor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He requested the services of His Eminence, the Witchfinder General. You may tell him that he has arrived. All eyes turn to the figure in the coach. Only a bejeweled hand is visible, resting on the coach's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Soldier places a wooden step next to the coach and another opens the door. The whole village has turned out, but they're keeping their distance. Even Attewater, standing front and center, seems uneasy. The figure emerges from the coach. A grizzled man with penetrating eyes and a black beard, wearing a strange amalgam of priestly white robes and decidedly un-priestly battle armor. A broadsword hangs from his hip, the hilt depicting Christ on the cross. With the sword sheathed, the cross is upside-down. This is FATHER SOLOMON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is indeed an honor, Your Eminence. Solomon makes no response. His eyes are on the severed wolf's head on display. Attewater smiles proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you can see, our werewolf problem has been dealt with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is no werewolf. Surprise and outrage ripple through the crowd. Isabelle and Roxanne exchange a shocked look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When a werewolf dies, it returns to its human form. If what you killed was a werewolf, then you would have a human head skewered atop that pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I suppose you've seen this? A wolf turning into a man? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon levels a look at the Reeve and slowly walks toward him. The Reeve is taller, but Solomon is, without doubt, the bigger man. The Reeve's eyes flick nervously to the armored Soldiers and their swords. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife's name was PAnAlope. She was very pretty. And we were very happy. The Reeve tries to keep the confusion off his face. Attewater and Father Auguste exchange uncertain looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We lived in a village not unlike this place. And not unlike this place, our village was plagued by a werewolf. I went out with some men to hunt it. It never even occurred to me that we might actually find it. But we did. He has everyone's attention now. All eyes are on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It attacked me. All I saw were yellow teeth. I hacked at it with an axe and suddenly it was gone. There was blood on my axe. I had cut off one of its paws. I picked it up and put it in my sack. (BEAT) When I returned home in the morning, I found my wife with a bloody rag tied around her left wrist. And when I opened my sack, the werewolf's paw was gone. This is what I found in its place. Solomon takes an old leather sack from his belt, reaches inside... and pulls out a WOMAN'S MUMMIFIED HAND wearing a wedding ring. There are gasps from the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name was PAnAlope. She was very pretty. And we were very happy. Until the day I killed her. Solomon turns and gives Attewater a hard look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your werewolf is still alive. And I promise you, it will kill again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soldiers stand at every door. Solomon and Attewater sit in front of the gathered Villagers. Solomon's Captain stands behind him. Isabelle nervously notes that the Captain wears a spiked flail. The black iron ball is shaped like a skull with spikes coming out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have examined the body of your blacksmith. There were bruises on his neck from where the beast held him in its jaws, squeezing his throat so that he could not scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he did scream. We all heard him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only when it wanted you to. It used him as bait to lure you into the bit of theater it had prepared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theater? My father is not playacting. He is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I killed the beast that did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what it wants you to think. It did kill your blacksmith. But the animal that you killed was not the werewolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was blood dripping from its teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood was its own. The werewolf most likely wounded it earlier in the evening and left it in the cave for you to find and kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Most likely,' he says. Have you ever heard anything more unlikely in your lives? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Villagers laugh. Lucrece eyes them, disapproving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Eminence, if what you say is true, that we were somehow fooled by this thing, it could not have done so without foreknowledge of our plan to hunt it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's correct. The werewolf does not live in the forest as you have rather naA vely assumed. It lives here in the village. Among you. There is a moment of shocked silence. Then mounting anger. Cesaire stands up and gestures to Henri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come here and tell us that this boy's father died for nothing. You accuse us and call us fools. Well, I believe what I can see with my own eyes. That wolf is dead. And I know it's dead because I was with the brave men who killed it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what of the festival?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The festival was to celebrate the death of the Wolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we say that it's dead! We've spent every full moon for the past forty years cowering in our homes. We've earned a celebration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And paid for it in blood! Attewater gives Solomon a nervous look. Solomon shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have your festival. I will stay on here until then to ensure that you have the celebration you all so richly deserve. The Villagers seem appeased, especially the smug Merchant. A look passes between Solomon and his Captain. Isabelle catches it... and finds it unsettling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moon sign displays the angry full moon, but it has been decorated with ribbons and mistletoe. Despite the cold, the mood in the village is happy and excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon is anointing each of his Soldiers with holy water from a basin held by Father Auguste...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto. Sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et sempter, et in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle wears her best dress, her hair decorated with ribbons. Cesaire is asleep, a flask in his hand. Suzette knits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to the festival.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right then. She doesn't look up from her knitting. Isabelle leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon kneels in prayer, lit by flickering candlelight. He kisses the image of Christ on the hilt of his sword...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The festival is in full swing. A bonfire ROARS. The Villagers sing and drink. A MAN in a wolf costume jumps out and startles the women and children. The children chase him with sticks and he comically runs away. Isabelle watches their antics with Roxanne and Prudence. Claude is laughing and chasing the man in the wolf costume, but an OLDER BOY purposefully trips him. Another BOY steals his cap and teases him. Marguerite is too busy carousing to notice. Roxanne frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hurries to help Claude. Isabelle and Prudence watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She acts more like a mother to him than a sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone has to look after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. But who looks after her? Isabelle gives Roxanne a sad look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain of Solomon's guard stands watch. The sounds of the FESTIVAL can be heard in the distance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men play MUSIC and couples dance. Roxanne dances with Claude, Prudence with an OLDER BOY... but Isabelle sits alone, watching Peter dance with Rosemaria. Just then, Henri stumbles toward Isabelle with a beer, clearly the latest of many. He follows her look and sees that she's watching Peter. Henri glares at him... ... then abruptly pushes his way toward Peter and grabs him roughly by the shoulder, spinning him around. Peter is surprised, but ready to laugh it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't come with us. The night my father died. Peter's smile fades. Isabelle rushes to pull Henri away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stayed here and let real men do the work you didn't have the belly for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, don't do this -- Henri brushes her aside, but too hard and she stumbles. Peter instantly grabs hold of Henri's wrist. Henri (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: overreacts and punches Peter in the eye. Peter falls on his ass, but the Villagers just laugh. Peter slowly stands, staring Henri down. He could easily lay Henri out... but decides against it. He leaves. Rosemaria reaches out to him, but he ignores her. Isabelle shoots Henri a look of contempt, then hurries off after Peter. Henri watches her go, ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter storms off. Isabelle runs after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter! Wait!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? So you can hit me, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want to make sure you're all right. Peter stops. He whirls on Isabelle, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't you just leave me alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what? What's the matter with you? What do I have to do to make you stop caring about me? Isabelle is taken aback. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I want to feel like this? You think I enjoy feeling like a fool every day because I can't stop loving you? Peter's bravado falters. He can't completely hide what her words do to him. She looks up at him, realizing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you with Rosemaria? You hate Rosemaria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have to like her to get what I want from her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a terrible liar. Isabelle takes a step closer and presses the palm of her hand against his chest. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. You're heart is starting to beat faster. And the little black circles in the middle of your eyes still get bigger when I touch you. She gazes up at him. He tries not to look in her eyes, but can't stop himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can tell me you don't love me, but I know what you're really feeling. I can feel it with my hand and see it with my eyes. Peter hesitates, then covers her hand with his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought being with Rosemaria would be the one thing you would never be able to forgive. I wanted you to hate me. (off her look) Isabelle, you are the best thing that could ever happen to me. And I am the worst thing that could ever happen to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you think that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't born here. You and I both know what that means. I will always be a stranger to these people. Your parents will never let us be together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That means less to me now than ever. We can leave here. We can go someplace where we'll both be strangers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't let you do that. You have something here that I will never have. You have a place. You have (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a family. With Henri you have a future. I'm not going to let you ruin that over me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only life I want is with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle... I'm wrong for you.
direction.name: direction
