direction.raw_text: I know you are. I just don't care. She kisses him on the mouth, then quickly steps back, as if she did it before she could change her mind. Then he takes her in his arms and they kiss, long and hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door opens and Peter and Isabelle enter, still kissing. He closes the door, pushes her against it with his body. He lowers her to pile of straw in an empty stall. She looks up at him, surprised, then pulls him tightly to her, kissing him hard. She grabs his hand and guides it to her breast. Now Peter looks surprised. He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not like this. (A BEAT) I want to marry you. She searches his face and sees that he's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can pack the cart tonight and we can leave in the morning. (off her look) Is that too soon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not soon enough. She pulls him to her and kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter looks outside. The coast is clear. He and Isabelle slip out and close the door behind them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better get back before someone misses you. She gives him a lingering kiss. When she pulls away from him, he sees that she's crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This feels like a dream. I'm afraid if I leave you I might wake up. He kisses her and holds her tight. Neither of them notice Henri, angrily watching from the shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle returns to the festival. She sits next to Roxanne, who notices a piece of straw in Isabelle's hair. Isabelle quickly brushes it away, embarrassed. Isabelle's eyes go to the sky. The sun has finally set. The moon has risen, silver and full. Isabelle gazes up at it, transfixed. Roxanne looks over at her, curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen it full before... Suddenly -- the CHURCH BELLS start to ring. Everyone falls silent. Confused looks all around. Then, somewhere in the dark... ... a WOLF HOWLS. The Villagers gasp. A WOMAN screams. People start to panic. Claude is knocked down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claude! Then something massive pushes its way through the surging crowd, bursting from the darkness... It's THE WOLF. The Villagers gape in horror. It makes the wolf that they killed look like a chihuahua. But there's something about its face that isn't canine at all, but ghoulishly human as it HOWLS at the moon. Suddenly, a group of Villagers throw off their cloaks, revealing themselves to be Solomon's armored Soldiers. Each of them draws a gleaming sword and points it at the Wolf. They've been lying in wait and now they have it surrounded. The Wolf SNARLS at them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moment later, Father Solomon gallops into the square on his armored steed, wearing a helmet adorned with a golden eagle. He tugs the reins and his horse rears back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get to the church, you fools! The Wolf SNARLS up at him. Solomon gives a battle cry:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! AND LONG LIVE GOD'S HOLY LOVE! The Wolf ROARS. Solomon and his men charge toward it. The Villagers caught between them trample one another to get away. A MAN gets knocked into the bonfire. Flaming logs fall off the pyre and set a cottage ABLAZE. The Wolf swipes Solomon's Soldiers aside like rag dolls. They bravely press the attack, but they're no match for the beast. It swats one of them right through the wall of a nearby cottage. The ambush has backfired. The Carpenter sees Claude on the ground and picks him up, trying to help. Claude fights and screams, but the Carpenter carries him away. Roxanne starts toward him -- -- and is bowled over by Solomon's horse. Solomon grabs the stake with the wolf's head atop it and charges at the Wolf, wielding the stake like a lance. The Wolf catches the stake in its jaws, throwing Solomon off his horse. Just as the Wolf is about to pounce on him, but more Soldiers join the fight. The Wolf sees them coming. It attacks Solomon's horse, biting its neck and dragging it to the ground. As the Soldiers close in -- -- the Wolf spins around, hurling the injured horse at them, knocking them down like bowling pins. Another Soldier tries to attack the Wolf from behind, but it smacks him aside with its tail and then smashes him to the ground with one enormous paw. Isabelle hurriedly helps Roxanne to her feet and drags her away from the ongoing battle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Claude? Where is he?!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AND LONG LIVE GOD'S HOLY LOVE

direction.raw_text: The Carpenter runs away with Claude in his arms, but Claude bites his hand and wriggles free. Claude falls to the ground and dashes back toward the square.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne runs through town like a rat in a maze, jostled by the fleeing Villagers. Isabelle races after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claude! Claude! Roxanne spots Rosemaria and grabs her, begging for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen my brother? Please! But Rosemaria just pushes her aside, panicked. An instant later -- the Wolf appears out of nowhere, jumping on Rosemaria. She screams, then -- CRUNCH. The screams stop. Isabelle and Roxanne gape in horror, then run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain RINGS the church bell. People are fleeing the village and running toward the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The few Villagers left hurry into their homes and bolt the doors behind them. TWO SOLDIERS search the nearly empty streets for the Wolf, swords drawn. Soldier #1 looks down... and sees bloody paw prints in the snow. He points them out to Solider #2. They follow the tracks to a corner, carefully peer around it... The Wolf is about ten feet away, loudly tearing meat from Rosemaria's body. Soldier #1 gestures for his companion to approach from the other side. They split up. Soldier #1 peers out at the Wolf... but it's gone. The street is empty. Only Rosemaria's body lying in the bloodstained snow. He ducks back around the corner... ... and we see that the Wolf is now right behind him. Meanwhile, Soldier #2 is stealthily making his way into position... when he suddenly hears Soldier #1 SCREAMING. Soldier #2 quickly ducks inside a nearby cottage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and peers out the window. He sees Soldier #1 painfully crawling through the snow, clutching a mangled and bloody wound on his shoulder. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help... Help me... Soldier #2 ducks back from the window. No way. He's not going out there. Then: SNIFF. SNIFF. There's a shadow visible under the crack of the cottage door. And a big black snout pressed up against it,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out its prey. Soldier #2 readies his sword... ... but then the Wolf moves away. A long beat. The Soldier edges toward the door. The shadow does not return. He slowly reaches out a hand to open the door... Suddenly, the door is blasted off its hinges and the Wolf bursts inside. It stands on top of the door, pinning the Soldier beneath it. The Soldier tries to raise his sword, but can't. The Wolf SNARLS down at him, drooling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf is dragging Soldier #2's body out of the cottage by the ankles when its ears suddenly prick up. It's heard something. It's being watched. It looks up... ... and sees Claude standing at the end of the street, paralyzed with fear. The Wolf GROWLS, blood dripping from its chin. Claude runs. The Wolf leaps after him. Claude turns a corner, looks back, sees the Wolf headed right for him. Claude ducks into an alley and the Wolf follows him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... only to find Claude has disappeared. The Wolf follows Claude's tracks in the snow to the door of a barn and peers inside. The barn appears to be empty... ... but Claude is hiding in a hayloft. The Wolf SNIFFS the air. Pushes the door open with its nose and pads inside. Looks around. Claude shivers. But just then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Claude! Claude!! The Wolf cocks its ears toward the voice, listening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Roxanne are the last stragglers, Roxanne looking for Claude, Isabelle trying to stop her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claude! Where are you?! Isabelle drags her to the ground and covers her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to stop it. He can't hear you and you are going to get us killed. Do you understand me? Roxanne nods, crying. Isabelle helps her up -- and finds herself face-to-face with the Wolf. Roxanne screams. They run back the way they came, turn another corner -- EXT. VILLAGE - ALLEY - NIGHT -- but the narrow alley is blocked by a high stone wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Isabelle climbs the wall, but Roxanne's not going to make it. Isabelle jumps down to help her... ... just as the Wolf's shadow falls over the alley. The girls watch helplessly as the Wolf slowly walks toward them, SNARLING and glaring at them with its strange, near- human eyes. Then, inexplicably... the Wolf speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well. You look very pretty this evening, my dear. Good enough to eat. The Wolf's voice is sonorous, seductive. The Devil's voice. Isabelle stammers, unable to believe her senses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's considered polite to thank someone when they pay you a compliment. Are you being impolite, Isabelle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know me? Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle...? The Wolf GROWLS, cutting her off, and turns back to Isabelle. It moves closer. Isabelle looks into its eyes. They suddenly seem very big and deep, almost hypnotizing. She seems to fall into them... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What big eyes you have...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The better to see you with, my dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to kill us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill you? Why would I kill you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you, Isabelle. Isabelle gapes, dumbstruck and dismayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are the same, you and I. We are both wild things. You show one face to the world, but there is another face that you hide. A fire burning inside you, waiting to be released. The Wolf sniffs her, starting at her feet and working its way up. It SNARLS with satisfaction, savoring her scent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I can smell it on you even now. Suddenly, the Wolf jumps onto its hind legs, puts its forepaws on the wall on either side of Isabelle, its muzzle only inches from her face. She recoils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave with me tonight. Run with me. The only shackles binding you are of your own making. Slip them and I can show you the world and every pleasure in it. Isabelle hesitates, then finds the strength to speak:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who you are, but we are not the same. I would rather die than go with you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about your fat friend here? Do you think she would rather die? (off Isabelle's look) Come away with me. Or I will kill her. And I will keep killing until you agree to leave with me. Suddenly, the sound of MEN SHOUTING. The Wolf leans in,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Isabelle turns away from its foul breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Choose now. Quickly. Isabelle trembles. She looks down at Roxanne's terrified face, torn. Isabelle closes her eyes. She can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your silence has doomed them all. Just then, Solomon and two Soldiers turn the corner. The Wolf leaps atop the wall and growls down at Isabelle:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come the next full moon, their blood will be on your hands. Then it jumps over the wall. Solomon scrabbles up after it, but the Wolf is already too far away. It looks back at him. A silent challenge passes between them. And then the Wolf is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon and his Soldiers bring Isabelle and Roxanne inside. A crowd of panicked Villagers swarms to Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are safe here. God protects his own house and those within it. Isabelle finds Prudence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Peter here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter? I don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Claude? Or my parents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen any of them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you look for them? Please? Prudence nods and rushes off. Roxanne slumps in a corner, a dazed look on her face. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talked to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It talked to us. A chill runs down Roxanne's spine. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It only growled. (off Isabelle's look) You heard it talk to you? Isabelle doesn't know what to say. She glances around to see if anyone has overheard. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not speak of this to anyone. Roxanne nods, but eyes Isabelle warily. Isabelle turns away, afraid and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. The door CREAKS open and the Merchant peers out. A blanket of new snow covers the village. It's as if the massacre of the night before never happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle hurries inside. Embers burn in the fire pit. A chair has been overturned. The room is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother! Father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle bursts in to find Suzette lying in bed and Cesaire leaning over her, crying. Isabelle stops short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thank God. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits up, revealing Suzette's face, which has been horribly slashed from scalp to chin. Isabelle recoils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Villagers slowly gather. Dead bodies litter the snow. Roxanne clutches Prudence's arm. Henri joins them. Father Auguste crouches next to Soldier #1.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man is alive! (TO HENRI) Bring me water! Hurry! Henri nods and quickly turns -- but is stopped cold by Solomon's iron grip on his arm. Solomon and his Captain go to Soldier #1. Solomon kneels at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you bitten? Shivering, the Soldier nods. The Captain closes his eyes. Solomon stands and turns to Father Auguste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step back. Confused, Father Auguste does as he's told. Then, before anyone can react, Solomon draws his sword and plunges it into the Soldier's heart. Everyone startles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The werewolf's bite is the same as death to a man. Stunned silence. Solomon turns to the Villagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dark days have returned to your village. Your homes are no longer safe. The Wolf will return. Again and again. And it will not stop until it has sucked the marrow from all your bones. Unless you stop it. (BEAT) But to kill a monster, you must become one yourself. A wolf caught in a trap will chew off its own leg to save itself. Will you do the same? What sacrifice will you make to save your families and your way of life? Will you do whatever it takes? Or will you (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cower in your beds and die like sheep? A long beat. The Villagers shiver and not just from the cold. But no one speaks. Solomon turns to Attewater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears my expertise is not as appreciated as I was led to believe. He turns to leave. Suddenly, Attewater steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Attewater drops to one knee. Solomon stops and gives him an appraising look. Then Solomon turns to the Villagers. After a moment, the Reeve drops to his knee. One by one, the Villagers kneel to Solomon. Henri and Father Auguste are among the last, but they reluctantly kneel as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will do what must be done. A beat. Then Solomon offers his hand. Attewater kisses Solomon's ring. Henri and Roxanne exchange uneasy looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an urgent knock at the door. Peter quickly opens it. It's Isabelle. He ushers her inside. As soon as the door is shut, he takes her in his arms. She gives him a concerned look. He looks tired, drawn and pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was up all night worrying about you. Thank God you're safe. But something about her expression gives him pause. She looks up at him, struggling with what she has to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter... My mother's hurt. I can't leave. Not now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you didn't want to wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have any choice. It's not just my mother. Something else happened last night. (off his look) (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell you about it. I just have to stay. Peter nods, but his face darkens. A long, tense beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I meant everything I said. This isn't what I wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. You'd better go home and see to your mother. She gives him a sad nod, then turns to go. She pauses at the door, but he doesn't look at her. She leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon places his silver sword on the table in front of Attewater and Father Auguste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silver. This is our most potent weapon. One blow will kill it. (BEAT) That sword has tasted the blood of many such creatures. But never one as powerful as this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's that powerful, how can we possibly hope to stop it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must find it in its human form. Who among you do you suspect? Attewater and Father Auguste trade uncomfortable looks. Neither of them wants to speak up first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has not survived this long by being obvious. The signs will be subtle. Insomnia. Restlessness. Strange behavior. Strange smells. (off their looks) Well, none of them smell good, but we must start somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the hair Madame Ordeville found on Lucie's body? It was dark. The person we are looking for must have dark hair. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps. Unless it planted the hair to make us think that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's trying to trick us again. This has been happening for forty years. It must be an old man by now. The hair should have been gray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not necessarily. It may be the child or grandchild of the werewolf that first struck here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The curse is hereditary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is. But it effects men and women differently. A man can inherit the curse. Or he can be turned simply by being bitten. Solomon turns toward the fire and stares into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But women are immune to the werewolf's bite. In order for a woman to be turned, she must inherit the curse. But even then it will lie dormant unless she eats human flesh. Only then will the bite of a male werewolf change her. Only then can she become a werewolf and capable of passing the curse on to her own children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it could be a woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. It could be any one of you. Attewater and Father Auguste exchange a wary look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mood of the village is grim. Isabelle meets Roxanne at the crossroads. Roxanne eyes her warily. A beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has Claude come home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody has seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's run away before. He'll be all right. Roxanne nods, unconvinced. Prudence joins them. They all exchange a sad look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. I suppose this is all of us. The three of them turn and start toward the woods...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Grandmother sit by the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It talked to you. And you understood it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As clearly as I do you now. Grandmother fixes her with a serious look. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Word of this cannot be allowed to spread. Do you understand me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne will never speak of it. She won't even talk to me about it. A long beat. Isabelle is working up her nerve. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to do what it wants. (off her look) I have communed with an unholy beast. What does that make me if not cursed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. But I won't allow you to go with this devil and live as its concubine. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if it comes back for me and I don't go with it, then it will kill again. If I have the power to save even one life, aren't I compelled to do so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is why it chose you. You're a good girl with a gentle heart. It's using that against you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how could it? Unless it really does know me? Isabelle and Grandmother exchange an anxious look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is walking home through the snow. Henri is waiting for her. A beat. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spoke with your father. I broke off our engagement. (off her look) I saw you with Peter. Don't worry, I didn't tell anyone. Isabelle can't hide her shock. She shifts anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about my family's debt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no interest in ruining your family. I will have you out of love or not at all. Isabelle is dumbfounded. Henri turns and walks away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is cooking, lost in thought. Suddenly, there's a KNOCK at the door. Isabelle opens it. It's Prudence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've caught the werewolf!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prudence leads Isabelle and Cesaire through the village. There are SHOUTING VOICES up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been hiding in a hayloft. They caught him trying to steal food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But who is it? An angry crowd has gathered. Solomon's Soldiers are all that's stopping it from turning into a lynch mob. Isabelle finds Roxanne in tears, trying to force her way through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? What's happening? Roxanne doesn't answer, just plunges into the crowd. Isabelle goes in after her. Cesaire tries to stop her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle! Get away from there! She follows Roxanne to the front of the crowd, just as two Soldiers haul a figure out of a barn -- it's Claude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claude!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not him! It can't be!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's not the werewolf, then why was he hiding? What's he afraid of? The Soldiers carry Claude off and Roxanne stumbles after them. Isabelle tries to follow, but Cesaire stops her. She can only watch helplessly as Claude is dragged away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Villagers are gathering. The whole town must be here. As Attewater approaches the entrance:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Salus populi suprema est lex. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and sees Grandmother walking toward him. She nods to the inscription above the entrance. 'SALUS POPULI SUPREMA EST LEX.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The good of the people is the chief law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You read Latin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And write. I was studying to be a nun when I met my husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He must have been some man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a priest. She grins. Is she being serious? Attewater bristles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the boy is innocent. He's being tried because he's different. Because Father Solomon knows he can turn us against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Solomon is here to protect us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wolf hunting sheep picks off the weakest ones first. (off his look) This is just the beginning. She enters the manor hall. Attewater watches her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is crammed with Villagers. Isabelle sits with Cesaire and Grandmother. Attewater sits behind the table. Claude is shackled and guarded by Soldiers. He looks afraid, confused. Solomon questions Lucrece. A SCRIBE records the proceedings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say you saw the accused perform magic? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In broad daylight with my own eyes. Everyone here has seen it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it was common knowledge that the accused was a conjurer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Your Eminence. I saw it for the Devil's work, but they laughed at me and paid him money. Isabelle and Grandmother exchange a concerned look. Through a SERIES OF CUTS, more witnesses are questioned:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shifts uncomfortably as Solomon interrogates him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you aware that it is the custom of witches and devil worshippers to hold their black sabbaths in cemeteries?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Your Eminence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do you know of their practice of dancing with invisible devils during these rituals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have heard it said so, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there one here today who you have seen dancing in your cemetery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hesitant; a beat) Yes. But I don't believe he meant anything by it. It was in jest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you consider the black mass to be a jest? There are suspicious WHISPERS among the Villagers. Father Auguste eyes them nervously. A beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then point him out. Father Auguste reluctantly points to Claude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne weeps as her mother testifies against Claude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your relationship to the accused?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am his mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where is his father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what is his name? She pauses. The crowd eyes her, disapproving. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never learned his name, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say a man whose name you cannot recall is the father of your child? What can you tell us about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much, sir. She lowers her eyes, ashamed. Solomon considers her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost as if it were a dream? (off her look) Certain devils called incubi can collect human semen and then transfer it to women as they sleep. A woman who unwittingly conceives in this manner would not be a whore. She would be blameless in the eyes of God. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marguerite's eyes spark, suddenly hopeful...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember almost nothing of the man who impregnated you. Is it not possible that there was no man? That the accused is not the product of your own sin, but the foul offspring of a werewolf whose semen was placed in you by an incubus while you slept?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes, I remember now! He came to me in my sleep! It wasn't my fault! God save me, it wasn't my fault! Roxanne buries her face in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon addresses the gathered Villagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have proven here today that behind this veil of feigned idiocy is the fiend that has plagued your village. However, in order for the sentence of death to be carried out, the Church requires either a confession or the testimony of a witness who has seen the accused in his transformed state. Since the accused has refused to confess, this court calls upon its final witness. Isabelle Ordeville. Isabelle is stunned. All eyes turn toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle stands before Solomon. Claude waves. She ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the night of the last full moon, you were attacked by the Wolf. You looked it in the eye. And the one thing a werewolf can never change is its eyes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures to the Soldiers. They grab Claude and force him to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look into his eyes, my child. Do you see the beast in them? Isabelle gives Claude a pitying look. Solomon watches, expectant. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't him. It can't be. He was with us when the Wolf attacked. Solomon is taken aback. Surprised MURMURS in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this true? Is there another here who can speak to this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can! It's true! I saw him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's his sister! She'll say anything! The suspicious Villagers agree. Roxanne gives Isabelle a desperate look. Then Isabelle spots the Carpenter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was there! He carried Claude away! He saved his life! Suddenly, all eyes are on the Carpenter. He shrinks back. He glances at his WIFE. She stares at him. Hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is mistaken. I did no such thing. Isabelle is shocked. She looks to the other Villagers, but no one will speak up. Solomon frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. Since no one here can bear witness, we must extort a confession. This court shall reconvene tomorrow at dawn. Solomon leaves. Claude is dragged out of the room by Soldiers. Isabelle gives Grandmother a helpless look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Grandmother sit at the table. Cesaire is in the other room feeding Suzette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why wouldn't Father Solomon listen to me? Doesn't he care that Claude isn't guilty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd rather let an innocent boy die than risk letting the Wolf go free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the Wolf is free. And the moon will be full in two days. The full weight of this hits home. Grandmother leans close, lowers her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We both know it will be coming for you. You must leave here tomorrow and never return. A long beat. Isabelle reluctantly shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cannot leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no choice. The alternative is unthinkable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is unthinkable is that I should be responsible for the deaths of everyone that I love. I'd rather spend a lifetime of misery than let that happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf's sins are on its own twice-damned soul, not yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what if it was you it wanted? Would you go with it to save me? Or would you leave me to die? Grandmother doesn't have a fast answer for that. Suddenly, a HIDEOUS, INARTICULATE SCREAM echoes in the night. Isabelle and Grandmother exchange a grave look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother and Isabelle step outside, followed by Cesaire. The SCREAMING can be heard more clearly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Solomon. Extorting his confession. Claude's screams sending chills down their spines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have condemned him today. At least it would have been quick. Cesaire turns and goes back inside. Isabelle and Grandmother continue to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne weeps with her hands clamped around her ears, trying to block out the SCREAMING. Her mother sits by the fire as if nothing unusual is going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you just sit there and listen to this? Marguerite ignores her. Furious, Roxanne stands up and grabs Marguerite's coin purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going with that? Roxanne doesn't answer, just pulls on her cloak. Marguerite grabs her, but Roxanne turns and shoves her to the ground. Marguerite starts to get up, but Roxanne snatches a knife from off the table and points it at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you touch me again. Ever. Roxanne angrily throws the knife aside and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fire burns underneath a 'Brazen Bull,' a hollow, life- size bull made of brass. The fire heats the metal to almost red-hot. Claude's screams come from inside it. Solomon glowers, frustrated. Attewater looks sick. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough of this. Let's eat. He gestures to the Scribe, who hands Attewater a document.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A statement declaring that you heard the boy confess. All it requires is your signature. Or your mark, if you cannot write.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he has not confessed. How could he have? Solomon studies Attewater. A beat. Solomon shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. Listen more carefully this time. He gestures for the Soldiers to throw more wood on the fire. The FLAMES leap higher. Attewater goes pale. All he hears are screams. Solomon stands next to the bull. The flames gleam off the brass, casting him in hellfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to how he sings of his love of Satan. How he despairs that he will never again copulate with the dead or sink his teeth into the flesh of pregnant women and eat their unborn children. Attewater gives Solomon a horrified look, suddenly realizing. Father Solomon is insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You stop it. (off his look) We both know he is guilty. But I cannot legally execute him without a witness or a confession. Sign this and we have a confession. Attewater glares at Solomon, then angrily signs the document. Solomon gestures to his Soldiers, who open the bull and pull Claude out. Attewater has to look away. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Solomon grabs Attewater by his collar, drags him across the room, and forces him to look at Claude. Thankfully, we do not see him, except in deep f.g. His naked flesh is actually smoking. Attewater cringes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the business of werewolf hunting and you had best develop a stomach for it. Because where there is one werewolf, there are two. And where there are two, there are more. (BEAT) This is only the beginning. Solomon throws him to the floor and leaves. Attewater trembles helplessly as Claude is dragged out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon is eating dinner. The Captain enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A girl to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've yet to come across a girl I wouldn't at least look at. The Captain ushers Roxanne inside. She meekly steps forward. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I assume you came here with a purpose. She hurriedly empties Marguerite's purse on the table in front of Solomon. A mere handful of coins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to bargain for the release of my brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your brother has just confessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? That's not possible!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has been witnessed and notarized. He will hang in the morning. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne stands frozen, gathering her courage for what she is about to say. Realizing that she has no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have more than money to offer you. She raises a trembling hand and starts to open her bodice, but Solomon interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think you are doing? (off her look) Do you have any idea who I am? I am the Witchfinder General. I have fought in the Holy Land. I have waded hip deep in blood and resisted all the temptations of the infidels. And you seek to stay the hand of justice with such a tawdry bribe? Leave here, girl, before I have you whipped. Solomon gestures for the Soldiers and they forcibly drag her away. Roxanne struggles against them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! I have something else! I know the name of a witch! Solomon looks up sharply. The Soldiers stop. Solomon crosses the room and stands glaring down at Roxanne. She cringes. This is the hardest decision of her life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spare my brother and I will tell you her name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Isabelle and her parents are jolted from their sleep by Soldiers barging into their home. One of them climbs into the loft and yanks Isabelle out of bed. Cesaire leaps to his feet, but is viciously beaten down. Suzette screams. The Soldiers drag Isabelle away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is thrown to the floor, the door SLAMMED behind her. She huddles against the wall, shivering. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then: A low MOAN in the dark. Isabelle startles. She looks up, her eyes going wide in disgust and horror... It's Claude. He's locked in a man-shaped cage, his body covered with hideous burns. He moans again. Isabelle chokes back her disgust and goes to him. She lightly takes his hand, shaken to her soul at the sight of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chamber is full again. Cesaire, Grandmother, Prudence, and Henri are here. Peter sits in the last row. Isabelle is in the seat of the accused. Roxanne stands witness. She's trying not to look at Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you acquainted with the accused?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how long did this friendship last?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And in this time, have you ever known the accused to converse with devils?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Your Eminence. On the night of the last full moon, she talked to the werewolf. And later she told me that it also talked to her. Isabelle gives Grandmother a frightened look. Cesaire clenches his fist. Solomon turns to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What of this? Do you deny having conversed with a werewolf? She looks to Roxanne, who trembles with emotion. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I do not deny it. The crowd REACTS. Solomon quiets them with a look. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Describe this encounter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It spoke, just as a man speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what was the nature of your conversation with it? Isabelle hesitates. Grandmother holds her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It told me... It promised to leave here and never return. But only if I leave with it. Roxanne gives her a stunned look. A heavy silence falls over the room. Even Solomon is surprised. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But who is it? Make her tell us who the werewolf is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! I swear I don't know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter who it is anymore. It wants her, not us. Let's just give it what it wants. A long, tense beat. Heavy silence. Nobody speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should not allow ourselves to even consider this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we already are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with you? You know her. You all know her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we? Did we know she could talk to werewolves?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could have run away. She could saved herself, but she stayed here because she cares more about you than she does herself. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter reacts. He and Isabelle exchange a look. Now he understands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she stayed, she did so because she is in league with it. Let this be her punishment. The crowd loudly AGREES. Solomon considers. Grandmother gives Attewater a dark look. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. Isabelle Ordeville, in light of your willing confession, it is the decision of this court that on the night of the next full moon, you be left to the mercy of the werewolf. Cesaire silently buries his face in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Henri bursts to his feet, turning heads. Isabelle is led away. Roxanne can only watch, helpless and ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucrece has drawn a small crowd around the well. Prudence pauses to hear what she's saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first victim was her sister. The second was her fiancAe's father. Then Rosemaria, who everyone knows she hated. And don't forget her mother, with half her face missing. All this death around one girl... Prudence has heard enough. She turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne approaches. The Captain eyes her, questioning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here for my brother. He gestures. Roxanne turns... and sees Claude's body dangling from a makeshift gallows. He's been hanged. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne falls to her knees. The rope around Claude's neck CREAKS as his body sways in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle stands at the barred door. Grandmother is on the other side. They speak in furtive whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to let these worthless shits sacrifice you to save themselves. We have to find the real werewolf before tomorrow night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's impossible. Even Father Solomon doesn't have the first clue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Solomon doesn't know the things that I know. (off Isabelle's look) I am the oldest person in this village who was here when the Wolf first came. I remember the old days. And what is happening now is much worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was it like in the old days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf never used to attack in the open like it did at the festival. It's a coward at heart. It would kill whole families in their homes, but it always stayed in the shadows. It never would have shown itself in the old days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's grown bold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or perhaps it made a mistake. (BEAT) You're at the center of this. At least two of the victims can be tied to you. What if it had to kill so many at the festival to hide the fact that the first two killings weren't random? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle considers this. A beat as she realizes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But who would want to kill Lucie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your parents said that the Wolf broke into the house and took Lucie. We both know that's not true. What really happened? Isabelle hesitates, reluctant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother made me swear I would never speak of it. (BEAT) Lucie went to the Wolf willingly. Grandmother reacts, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you think such a thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was in love with Henri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She took her own life over a boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What other explanation is there? Grandmother thinks. The pieces are fitting together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother knocks on a door. Henri answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Henri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri is in the midst of shoeing a horse. Grandmother stands by the door, watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spoke up very loudly in Isabelle's defense today. That was very brave. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just said what I felt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're under no obligation to stand in her defense. You broke off your engagement to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never stopped caring about her. I would do anything for Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As her sister would have done anything for you. (off his look) Lucie was in love with you. But you knew that, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had no control over the way she felt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kept it secret from almost everyone. Even Isabelle didn't know. Did you tell anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have to tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he knew your secrets, did he? Henri picks up a hammer and goes back to work. Angrily nailing a shoe to the horse's foot. BANG! BANG! BANG!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were the only one who could have lured Lucie out on the Wolf's night. And none of the men who went hunting for the Wolf remember seeing you after the sun set on the night your father died. Henri faces her, clutching the hammer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you doing this? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I want you to confess. You killed Lucie. And your father. And God only knows how many others. And if you won't admit it, then I will tell Father Solomon and we will lock you up until the moon rises tomorrow night and you can no longer hide your guilt. As she says this, a slow look of dawning realization comes over him. Realization and horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's you. Henri steps closer to her, menacing. Grandmother steps back and finds herself bumping against the closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, it's you. You're the Wolf. I can smell it on you now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smell what? What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night my father died. I saw the Wolf pass by, dragging him by the neck. I was so terrified I couldn't move or make a sound. I remember every detail of that moment. The way the moonlight gleamed off the Wolf's coat. The soundless way it moved. I even remember the way it smelled. A thick, greasy, musky stink. (BEAT) And I can smell it on you right now. A beat. They stand frozen. Glaring at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You accuse me and I'll bring you down with me. All they can do is take my life. You have more to lose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But who do you think they'll believe? I'm the blacksmith. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know me. You're the crazy old woman who lives in the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll have to prove it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless you can, you'd best keep your mouth shut. Another beat. A stand-off. Grandmother's hand finds the door handle. She turns it, stumbling outside -- EXT. STABLE - NIGHT -- and practically runs right into Cesaire. She startles, gives him a surprised, flustered look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready for me to take you home? She looks back. Henri stands in the doorway, still holding the hammer. She eyes him, measuring, suddenly hesitant. Cesaire gives them both an uncertain look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire and Grandmother ride in a horse-drawn cart. The moon is almost full. Up ahead, Grandmother sees Prudence with a group of Villagers listening to Lucrece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the cart. Cesaire pulls the reins. Grandmother calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prudence, come with me. I have some blankets I want you to mend for Father Auguste. Prudence sighs and climbs up into the cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cart stops out front. Grandmother turns to Prudence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take these blankets to Father Auguste the moment you're finished. Understand? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Cesaire helps Grandmother out of the cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother hands Cesaire a stack of knitted blankets. He has tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you want a ride into town tomorrow? To say goodbye to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. First thing in the morning. He nods shakily and leaves. She closes the door behind him and lets the faAade of calm fall from her face. She puts a trembling hand to her mouth, mind racing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Villagers go about their daily activities, but nobody speaks. The Herald hangs the full moon sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full moon! Full moon! Full moon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning sunlight glints off the frozen brook. A flock of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are startled from their roosts and take flight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother sits at the table, writing a letter in Latin with a quill. She doesn't notice the veil that separates her bedchamber rippling, as if in a gentle breeze... Suddenly, she hears MOVEMENT. She looks up. The veil is still. She stands and pokes the ashes of the fire with her cane, her back to the veil... ... and changes her grip on the cane. To wield it as a weapon. Glancing back, she sees the veil move again... Suddenly, she whirls around and swings her cane at the veil, sweeping through it three times without hitting anything. A beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show yourself! Coward! Another beat. The veil settles and is still. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lunges out of the veil with its arms reaching out at us. It grabs Grandmother's throat in one hand and wrestles the cane from her grip with the other. She struggles, but she's far too weak for her attacker. The Figure whips out a knife. Grandmother sees it, but can do nothing. The knife flashes. Fat drops of blood splash on the floor. Then the Figure drops Grandmother and she crumples, lifeless. A pool of blood slowly spreads out from underneath her. The Figure steps over the widening pool and picks up the letter Grandmother was writing. He quickly scans it and angrily tosses it in the fire... Then he hears something. FOOTSTEPS, crunching through the snow. He hurries to the window and peers out... It's Roxanne and Prudence. Roxanne looks like hell, but here for lessons as usual. The Figure ducks out of sight. A moment later, they're KNOCKING on the door. Their feet are visible under the crack. The Figure sidles alongside the door, BREATHING heavily. Another KNOCK. On the floor inside, the pool of blood is expanding toward the door... The Figure sees it. He puts a hand on the hilt of his knife... then whispers to the girls through the door, disguising his voice with a dry, old woman's rasp:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away. Outside, Roxanne and Prudence exchange a curious look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick. You can't come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sound awful. Would you like us to make you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You mustn't come in. Go home, now. I want to sleep. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood is flowing right toward the door. In about thirty seconds, the girls will be standing in it. Outside, Prudence and Roxanne exchange a look... ... then turn and walk away. The Figure breathes a sigh of relief and takes his hand away from the knife. But then Roxanne stops. And looks back. The Figure secretly watches from the window. Roxanne walks back to the cottage. The blood is about to run under the door. The Figure grabs the door handle and readies the knife. Roxanne stands on the doorstep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you don't want us to bring you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my dear. Come back tomorrow. The blood is seconds away from hitting her feet. The Figure stands poised to throw open the door... but at the last instant, Roxanne turns and walks away. She doesn't see the blood pour outside under the door behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle has fallen asleep on the bed of straw. She's startled awake by the sound of her CELL DOOR opening. It's Father Auguste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come to hear your final confession. Isabelle nods shakily and sits up. He enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has there been any word from my grandmother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None that I have heard. Why? Isabelle doesn't answer. She turns away, troubled...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter anxiously waits outside, half-hidden in a copse of trees. A SERVANT BOY runs up to him from the house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's still in the dungeon. They're going to move her at sunset. Peter tosses the Boy a coin. The Boy runs off. Peter looks at the stone house, his eyes hard and determined...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attewater walks with Father Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've hanged the werewolf. Why not let the girl go free?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, Bailiff. Where there is one werewolf, there are more. And the girl is the bait for our trap. Father Solomon strides off. Attewater watches him go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Villagers are already gathering. The Merchant looks up at the sun. It's now dipping beneath the rooftops...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter knocks on the door. Henri opens it. He eyes Peter dubiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help. Off Henri's look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attewater hurriedly enters and looks around. Nobody here except the BARMAN and Cesaire slumped in a chair, a jug of beer in his hand. Attewater goes to Cesaire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I went to pick her up this morning and she was gone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attewater reacts, concerned. Cesaire takes another drink. Attewater angrily knocks it out of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop pouring that swill down your gullet listen to me! Cesaire emerges from his drunken fog and shoots him a dangerous look, but Attewater doesn't shy from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was trying to find the werewolf. If she figured out who it is, I need to know now. Suddenly, the door bursts open and the Captain enters, flanked by Soldiers. They drag Cesaire to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! What has he done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a precaution. Father Solomon doesn't want the girl's family interfering. Suddenly, Cesaire pulls a club out of his boot and hits the Captain across the back, knocking him to his knees. Cesaire hits him again, then he's wrestled to the ground. The Captain kicks Cesaire in the face and knocks him out. The Soldiers drag him away. Attewater watches them go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soldiers haul Cesaire's unconscious body downstairs. Isabelle watches as they throw him in another cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to him?! Then: Isabelle's cell is opened. The Captain is holding iron manacles. Isabelle looks at them, horrified. The Soldiers clap her in irons. This is really happening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Isabelle... He's coming to. Isabelle breaks away from the Soldiers, runs to his cell, and holds his hands through the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you so much. Tell Mama and Grandmother that I love them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, my angel. You don't know how much. The Soldiers pull Isabelle away and lead her up the stairs. Cesaire shakes his cell door with impotent rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bastards!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is chained to the back of Solomon's coach. The Captain approaches with a 'humiliation mask': an iron mask that locks in place over the head with only tiny holes to see out of. This one is shaped to look like a wolf's head. Isabelle goes pale at the sight of it... ... then the Captain puts it over her head. Inside the mask: almost total darkness. The Captain locks it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon's coach lurches through the snow and slush. Isabelle trudges along behind it. The Villagers line the road to watch as she is dragged stumbling through the streets in her horrific iron wolf mask. Lucrece sneers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so pretty now, is she? The Villagers do not answer. Henri is here, silently fuming. Prudence stands next to him. She looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Peter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon, Attewater, and Father Auguste stand next to the stocks. As a crowd of anxious Villagers watches, Isabelle is placed in the stocks with the mask still on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We, Bailiff Attewater, Father Auguste, and Father Solomon of Avignon, having in mind that you, Isabelle Ordeville of Villiers la CroisAe in the Diocese of Saint- (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flour, by your own confession, have committed acts of vulgar heresy, convict you of the sins of witches and condemn you to the mercy of werewolf. This is the sentence given. Solomon walks away and Attewater reluctantly follows. Through the holes in the mask, Isabelle sees Father Auguste make the sign of the cross and sadly turn away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help... Father Auguste stops. The Villagers shift uncomfortably as her helpless voice calls out from inside the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me... Please... Help me... The Villagers start to leave, ashamed. Isabelle sees them going... and suddenly SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! PLEASE! WHY WON'T SOMEBODY HELP ME?! The Villagers startle. She SCREAMS again, struggling against the stocks. But no one comes to her aid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle's SCREAMS can be heard from here. Roxanne lies in her bed, sobbing her heart out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost everyone has left. Isabelle slumps in the stocks, silent and exhausted. Father Auguste sadly walks away, leaving only Prudence. She nervously approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle? Can you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can hear you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne wanted you to know how sorry she is. She only said those things to save her brother. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Will you tell her that I forgive her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. (BEAT) I wanted to say... I don't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to. (BEAT) I want you to know that you may have fooled Roxanne, but you don't fool me. Not anymore. You were always too good. Too pretty. Nobody could be as perfect as you. You tricked us. And now you're going to get what you deserve. A beat. Isabelle responds, surprisingly gentle:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you'd better go now. Prudence looks up. The sun has almost set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It won't be long now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain crouches in the shadows of a nearby barn. He watches Prudence leave. Solomon and Attewater join him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one shoots until I give the order. Attewater glances outside and sees Soldiers armed with longbows hidden all around the square. The Captain draws an arrow from his quiver. It's tip is made of silver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The streets are empty. The FULL MOON has risen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is now alone. The streets are empty. Around the square, Soldiers stand in tense silence, ready with arrows strung on their bows. Attewater shifts nervously. Suddenly: a long, ululating HOWL. Isabelle gasps. The Soldiers ready their bows. Attewater shrinks back. Another HOWL. Closer now. Isabelle tries to pull her hands out of the stocks. Then: Solomon spots something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. The Captain and Attewater follow his look. A BLACK SHAPE is stealing through the shadows toward Isabelle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold your fire... Isabelle frantically tries to free herself, her wrists torn and bleeding, but it's no use. Then, suddenly -- -- something SLAMS into the stocks. BANG! She can't see what it is. The stocks are hit again. Isabelle screams. Suddenly, the Shape moves into her field of view:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey! Stop it! It's me! Isabelle's eyes go wide. The Black Shape crouches and looks in at Isabelle through the eyeholes. It's Henri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not the Wolf! The moon is out! Look, I haven't turned! Isabelle realizes. He's right. It couldn't be him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to get you out of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes, please hurry! Solomon and his men watch as Henri uses a hammer and chisel to break open the stocks. BANG! BANG!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to free her. Then: another HOWL. Almost on top of them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patience. It's close now... Henri brings the hammer down again and again and -- BANG! The lock is cleaved in two. Henri throws the stock open and helps Isabelle out of the mask. She looks like hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you stand? Isabelle nods. In the loft:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him. Attewater gives Solomon a horrified look. The Captain strings an arrow and draws it back, taking aim... Suddenly, Attewater pushes him aside, spoiling the shot. The arrow whizzes by Henri's head. Attewater calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Isabelle and Henri see him -- just as Solomon plunges a dagger into his back. Henri drags Isabelle to her feet and they run away, arrows ZIPPING all around them. Solomon scowls as he watches them escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri leads Isabelle as they run through the village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get to the stable. Peter left his cart for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter? Where is he --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter. Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Captain and his Soldiers have picked up a few followers. They're raising the alarm. A MOB is forming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The witch has escaped! The witch has escaped!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri leads Isabelle around the back and helps her into a cart that is waiting for them and unhitches the horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri and Isabelle take off through the village in the cart... but then they hear a HOWL behind them. They look back. The Wolf emerges from the darkness, chasing after them. Henri whips the horse, urging it to go faster. They start to pull away from the Wolf, but then it veers off into the village and disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so... Just then, they pass by the Reeve and a group of Villagers. The Villagers start to give chase, but Isabelle and Henri quickly leave them behind. Meanwhile, the Wolf is shortcutting through the village, racing after the cart. It comes to a sheep pen and smashes through it. It comes to a large barn and leaps onto its roof, then leaps off again -- -- and lands within striking distance of the cart. Henri drives the horse, but it's no use. The Wolf lunges, wrestling the horse to the ground. The horse cries out, its body twisting as it falls, sending the cart flying. Isabelle falls out and lands hard. Henri lies on his side, clutching his wrist. Isabelle pulls herself together and goes to him. She looks at his arm. It's visibly broken. She helps him to his feet -- -- just as the overturned cart is SMASHED apart. The Wolf bursts through it, breaking it to pieces. It glares at them with bloodthirsty eyes. Isabelle and Henri back away from it, but their escape is blocked -- the Villagers have caught up. They freeze at the sight of the Wolf, but stand their ground. Isabelle and Henri are trapped. The Reeve shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take her! Take her and leave us in peace! The Wolf SNARLS at him and turns to Isabelle. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't outrun me, my dear. And there is no place you can hide that I cannot smell you out. (BEAT) So what is your decision? Will you take your place with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My place will never be with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you belong then? Here? With the cowards who so gladly sacrificed you to save themselves?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're still good people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are sheep. We are not like them. Let me show you what you are. The Wolf steps closer... but suddenly, Henri pushes Isabelle aside, pulls his hammer from his belt, and raises it to hit the Wolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from her! The Reeve quickly grabs him. Henri struggles futilely, but Isabelle seizes the distraction. She snatches a Villager's torch and jabs it into the Wolf's side. The Wolf leaps back with an eerily human YELP of pain. Before it can react, Isabelle waves the torch at the Villagers, grabs Henri and they run away. The mob chases after them. Three Soldiers appear and join the mob. Figures silhouetted against the snow, angry faces lit by torchlight. It's like a nightmare. Suddenly, a cottage in front of the mob EXPLODES into pieces and the Wolf bursts out of it. It turns on the Villagers and Soldiers. It picks up a fallen roof beam in its powerful jaws, clenches them, trembling with rage, and snaps the wooden beam in half like a twig. The Villagers run away in fear, but the Soldiers stand their ground and the Wolf attacks. Meanwhile, Isabelle and Henri escape... but there are more Soldiers up ahead. Isabelle and Henri quickly hide. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to tell you something. In case I die. (off Isabelle's look) Your grandmother is the Wolf. Isabelle recoils in disbelief. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf is a man. It told me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe it? Isabelle hesitates. He has a point. Henri peers out. The Soldiers are closing in on them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me. She takes his hand and leads him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle knocks at the door. Roxanne answers. She gives Isabelle a stunned look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to come inside. Quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Henri enter. Roxanne shuts the door. Marguerite gasps when she sees Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you lost your mind? If they find her here, they'll kill us, too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then shut up so they don't find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get out of town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll never make it. You can hide here until morning. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're searching everywhere. We have to keep moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might make it to the church. Even the king cannot violate the protection of sanctuary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the Wolf cannot cross onto holy ground. The three exchange a look. Sounds like a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we go out your back window? Roxanne nods. They hurry toward the window, but then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! I have an idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group of Villagers walks by. As they do, the Reeve hears something coming from behind the cottage...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Come on! The Reeve follows the voice and sees two figures that look like Henri and Isabelle climb out the back window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're here! Over here! The two figures run and the Villagers chase after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri and Isabelle hide behind a shed, just as the Villagers appear and spread out, trying to find them. Henri turns to Isabelle... only it's not Isabelle. It's Roxanne wearing Isabelle's clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you keep going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can if you can. They run off, chased by the Villagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle climbs out the back window undetected, dressed in Roxanne's clothes. The coast is clear. She runs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle can see the church steeple over the rooftops and races toward it. But then she hears a low GROWL ahead of her. Dark eyes peer from an open barn door. She turns and runs down an alley. The Wolf chases after her. As Isabelle nears the end of the alley, the Wolf suddenly appears in front of her, blocking her path. She races back the way she came, then darts into a gap between two outbuildings, barely big enough for her to pass through, too narrow for the Wolf to follow. But as she runs, she hears a LOUD CLAMORING above her. The Wolf is chasing her on the roof of one of the buildings. It's right over her. It shoves its head through the narrow space above her, SNAPPING its jaws, but can't quite reach her. Then suddenly -- -- the gap between the buildings closes further and the Wolf is stopped short, choking, its head caught in the narrow space. But Isabelle slips through, emerges from between the buildings, and is startled by a VOICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) There! The Captain is pointing at her. He has another Soldier with him. Isabelle runs. They chase after her... ... just as the Wolf frees itself. From the rooftop, it sees the Soldiers chasing Isabelle. It races after them, running across roofs and jumping from cottage to cottage. Isabelle runs into an alley that dead-ends at a low wall. There's firewood piled against the wall and Isabelle quickly scrabbles up it, but at the last second -- -- the Captain reaches out and grabs her ankle. She grabs a log and hits him over the head until he lets go. Then she jumps down to the other side. The other Soldier starts to climb after her, but is suddenly lifted right off his feet. The Captain looks up. The Wolf is standing on the adjacent roof and has picked the Soldier up in its jaws. It glares down at the Captain. It flings the Soldier in its mouth away like a dirty sock. The Captain gapes up at it in fear for a moment too long and then the Wolf is on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle's route has taken her right back to where she started. She spots the steeple and starts toward it... But there is someone here. Father Solomon. He's holding his silver sword. Isabelle freezes. For a moment, they just stand there, looking at one another. Then -- Isabelle turns to run. Solomon is on her in an instant. He grabs a fistful of her hair and throws her to the ground. She tries to get away, but he puts a knee in her back and ties her hands together with a length of rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least you won't die alone now. Your friends will all hang with you. Suddenly... a long, hideous SNARL. Behind them. Father Solomon turns. Isabelle cranes her neck and sees... the Wolf emerge from the alley she just came out of. Solomon picks up his sword and stands to face it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you come for her, you come through me. The Wolf GROWLS and raises its hackles. Solomon raises his sword. Just then, Henri and Roxanne run into the square, followed by a group of Villagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay back! Henri hurries to Isabelle's side. The Villagers watch, breathless, as Solomon and the Wolf circle one another. Solomon's sword starts to tremble. Sweat breaks out on his brow. The Wolf SNARLS with an almost mocking leer. Then, with a loud battle cry, Solomon charges. The Wolf leaps at him. Solomon raises his sword... ... and the Wolf's jaws clamp onto his wrist. Solomon screams. The Villagers watch, horrified, as the Wolf twists back and forth, like a dog with a chew toy -- -- biting off Solomon's hand. The hand falls into the snow, still clutching the silver sword. Solomon cries out in agony. The Wolf turns toward Isabelle and SNARLS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is your mighty werewolf hunter. Who will save you now? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle trembles. The Wolf slowly steps toward her, menacing... and is struck in the head with a rock. The Wolf stops, surprised to find Henri standing in its way. Henri picks up another rock and throws it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard! You killed my father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henri, what are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not letting it take you. He throws another rock and another. One hits the Wolf in the eye, tearing a gash in its face. The Wolf GROWLS.
direction.name: direction
