direction.raw_text: Look! It bleeds! We can kill it if we stand together! The Villagers waver. Henri beseeches them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father Solomon was one man. His soldiers were mercenaries. But we are a village! The Wolf SNARLS at him, but comes no closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. It's a coward at heart. Look at it. Why doesn't it attack? The Wolf SNARLS louder and takes a step toward her... but then the Merchant picks up a rock and throws it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed my daughter! Then another Villager joins them. The Wolf looks around. Villagers are emerging from the shadows all around it. It's surrounded. And not by a dozen soldiers, but by a solid wall of angry, determined men and women. The Wolf raises its hackles, trying to scare them, but they start closing in, jabbing at it with weapons and farm implements. It snaps and SNARLS at its attackers, but there are too many of them. Someone drives a spear into the Wolf and it screams in agony. It lurches around, biting at the spear, but can't reach it. Then Henri sees something in the snow... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon's sword. He pries it out of Solomon's severed hand and turns to face the Wolf, the angry Villagers gathered behind them. The Wolf trembles, blood dripping from its many wounds... then it turns to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will come for you again. And with that, it turns and flees into the night. The Villagers CHEER. The Reeve chases after it and the rest of the angry mob follows him. Henri turns to Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right? Isabelle nods, shaky. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) This isn't over. They turn. Solomon kneels, holding his bloody stump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am bitten. Henri and Isabelle exchange a look. A long beat. Henri walks over to Solomon, sword in hand. Solomon crosses himself and closes his eyes, unafraid. Roxanne turns away. Isabelle doesn't. Then Henri swings the sword. There is a soft THUMP as Solomon's head hits the snow. Henri throws the sword aside. Isabelle puts a reassuring hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle awakens in her bed. She looks around. She's still dressed in Roxanne's clothes from the night before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle enters to find Suzette putting food in a basket. Suzette stops when she sees Isabelle and gives her a hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's past noon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I didn't want to wake you. Isabelle smiles up at her. The wounds on Suzette's face are still bad, but healing. She's scarred for life. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be home soon. They have no reason to hold him any longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they catch the Wolf?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. They lost it in the forest. This gives Isabelle pause. A beat. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Grandmother? Suzette hesitates. Isabelle is suddenly concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roxanne came by. She said your grandmother has fallen ill. I was hoping you could look in on her. Off Isabelle's troubled look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle walks through the village wearing Lucie's red riding hood and carrying a basket of food. People lower their eyes as she passes. She spots Prudence gossiping with Lucrece. Prudence sees her, then looks away. The same pup we saw at the beginning is now a grown dog. It playfully follows Isabelle along the path, but stops as she enters the dark, fog-shrouded forest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle walks through the snow. A thick fog gives the forest a strange, dream-like feeling. A cold wind blows. Soon Isabelle becomes aware of FOOTSTEPS behind her. She stops and turns. Slowly, a figure appears. It's Peter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God you're all right. He tries to take her hand, but she pulls away. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. You sent Henri to help me. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he tell you? Isabelle gives him a hurt look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those people back there. I know they mean well, but they're just people. I didn't expect anything from them. I expected something from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to see my Grandmother. She's sick. Please don't follow me. Isabelle starts walking again. Peter just stands there, watching her go. When she looks back, he's gone. She sighs, wiping tears from her eyes. She continues on... Then: FOOTSTEPS behind her again. She stops and looks back. Listens. Nothing. She keeps walking. But then she HEARS them again. Looks back. A dark figure follows her in the fog. She walks faster. She reaches the fork in the path. She pauses. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are still behind her. She makes a decision. She breaks off a tree branch and backs toward the abandoned path, using the branch to sweep away her tracks in the snow. When she's far enough away from the main path, she throws the branch aside... ... and turns to face the abandoned path. It looks ominous. She gives it a wary look, then starts walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle reaches the rope bridge. More of the rotten boards have fallen out during the winter. Isabelle looks down. It's a long drop to the river below. She edges out, stepping carefully on the snow-covered boards, holding onto the rope with both hands... Suddenly -- CRACK! A board SNAPS under her weight. At the last instant, she regains her balance. The broken board SPLASHES into the water. She takes a moment to catch her breath before continuing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle crosses the little bridge and knocks on the front door. The fog still hangs over everything. She doesn't notice the dark stain under her feet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother? Are you awake? She listens at the door. A long beat. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Pull the bobbin. The latch will open. We recognize the thin, raspy voice. Isabelle hesitates, then pulls the bobbin and opens the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Reeve and a GUARD examine something O.S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're certain nobody has seen him since last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wolf must have taken him. What else could have done that? They're looking at the cell where Cesaire was locked up. The metal door has been ripped off its hinges...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle closes the door. A pot is cooking over the fire. The cat lounges in its heat, grooming itself. It looks up at Isabelle as she enters. Isabelle stops. The veil that has always been closed is now open. Beyond it, we see Grandmother propped up in bed. The light is too dim to see her very well, just a candle by her bed. She's wearing a nightgown and cap. She doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been expecting you. Isabelle starts toward the bedroom with the basket...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother sent some food. There are cakes and a pot of butter -- (CONTINUED) 105.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't come in here. Isabelle stops short. Grandmother's face is cloaked in darkness. Isabelle gives her a questioning look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? You sound so weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just made myself a stew. I left it over the fire for you. Isabelle glances back at the pot BUBBLING over the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here to take care of you. Not the other way around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be silly, my dear. You've been through so much. Sit down. Isabelle considers for a beat, then places the basket on the table, next to a ball of yarn with Grandmother's knitting needles sticking out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no burden so heavy that it doesn't seem a little lighter on a full stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always say that. She ladles some soup into a bowl and sits down. The cat looks up from its grooming, watching her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. Eat up, my dear. Eat up. Isabelle takes a bite of the hot soup. The cat jumps up on the table and lies down next to her, licking its paw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been worried about you. When you didn't come back yesterday, I was afraid... (BEAT) You were wrong about Henri. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. He saved my life. Isabelle takes another bite of soup, then pauses. She puts the bowl down and loosens her collar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel hot all of a sudden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just the stew warming you. Isabelle hesitates, but keeps eating. Then she takes a closer look at the cat. There's blood on its paw. That's what it has been licking this whole time. Suddenly, Isabelle feels faint. She breaks out in a sweat. She looks at the soup. A thick broth with chunks of white meat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't like it, there's wine on the table to wash it down. Isabelle reaches for the bottle with an unsteady hand and pours herself a cup. She takes a sip... and freezes. It's not wine. It's blood. She gags and drops the cup, spilling blood everywhere. The cat jumps away. She looks at the bottle, turns it over. More blood pours out. Isabelle screams and throws it, knocking over the pot and spilling the soup. The Figure laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, what pretty red lips. Come and give your Granny a kiss, my dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I will come to you. And with that -- Grandmother slowly starts to move. She groans. She's hurt. She stands up. She's much taller now than she was. As Isabelle watches in mute dread, the Figure pulls off Grandmother's nightgown and cap, hobbles into the firelight, revealing its face... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Cesaire. Isabelle quickly stands, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this? Where's Grandmother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I ate most of her. (BEAT) You ate the rest. Isabelle gives the spilled stew on the floor a horrified look. For a moment, she looks like she may pass out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to kill her. But she finally realized what I was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire bathes in a cold stream...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The hardest thing to hide has always been the smell. The werewolf musk is strong, especially close to the full moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night of the wolf hunt. Henri crouches in the woods, clutching his hammer... then freezes with terror. He sees the Wolf slink by in the dark, dragging Adrien along by his throat. It happened just as Henri said it did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Henri smelled it the night he saw me. And he recognized the smell later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother's confrontation with Henri. She stumbles outside and practically runs right into Cesaire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) He thought it was your Grandmother. He didn't know he was smelling me. But she did. She'd lived with the smell her whole life, she just had no way of knowing what it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother hands Cesaire a stack of knitted blankets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Once she realized what it was, of course, she knew the truth. She tried to sneak a message to Father Auguste last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire carries the blankets back to the cart. He quickly looks inside them and finds a note: 'MEUS FILIUS EST LUPUS.' Subtitle: 'My son is the wolf.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Luckily, she'd taught me how to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle shakes her head, tears streaming down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not the Wolf. You can't be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look into my eyes. The one part of me I can never change. Isabelle looks into his eyes... and recoils in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, dear God... You killed Lucie? You killed my sister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did more than that to her. Isabelle steps away from him, mind reeling. He snarls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only wish your mother could have known what I did to her. The girl she passed off as my daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night of the festival. SCREAMS can be heard coming from the village square. Suzette runs outside... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I was made a cuckold by your mother. But I paid her back. She hears a LOW GROWL. She turns, startled. It's the Wolf. It lunges at her, raking her face with its claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wolf hunt. Adrien hears SOMETHING move in the brush. He looks toward it... and sees the Wolf staring at him from the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I paid her lover back, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Isabelle's dismay, Cesaire has tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie was the joy of my life. But she wasn't mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, she was. In every way that matters, she was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not in every way that matters. My father sired me. I am a werewolf because it was in his blood. Because I was his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Grandmother know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. And neither does your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night Lucie died. Cesaire pours mugs of beer, but this time we see him sprinkle something in the beer before serving it -- Grandmother's sleeping herb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I put an herb in the beer to make you sleep whenever the moon was full. One of your Grandmother's old remedies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many years ago. Grandmother is in her 40s, asleep in a chair, holding an empty cup. Isabelle's GRANDFATHER takes the cup from her hand and quietly leaves. Grandmother sleeps peacefully by the fire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) That's how my father got away with it. Your grandmother never learned the truth. Until last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still many years ago. A werewolf runs through the woods... followed by a smaller werewolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I began to turn when I was fourteen. My father and I ran together. We hunted freely. Killing at will. The two werewolves are chasing a FRIGHTENED PEASANT, moving in for the kill...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mangled body of the Peasant has been discovered. A group of MEN stands around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Our only mistake was that we gorged ourselves too often on the fat flesh of the villagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two werewolves are running through the woods again, this time chased by VILLAGERS with torches and weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed my father. Suddenly, the larger werewolf falls into a pit filled with sharp stakes. It CRIES OUT in agony. The smaller werewolf looks down and WHIMPERS... ... watching as the larger werewolf begins to change before our eyes. It's reverting to its human form... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time the Villagers reach the pit, what they find is Grandfather's naked body skewered on the stakes. The smaller werewolf GROWLS at them and runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The fools thought my father had been thrown in the pit by the Wolf. They never suspected that he was the Wolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire labors in a field. He goes to church. He thatches the roof of his cottage in the hot sun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I tried to live as my father did, but I came to realize that I did not belong here. The Wolf was my true self. It wasn't something to be hidden. It was a gift. I had to leave here and never return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire stands in the cemetery, looking down at his father's grave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) But I did not want to go alone. My father and I were part of a long and powerful bloodline. It was up to me to see that it did not die out. I had hoped for a son to pass my gift on to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire mends a fence, but keeps glancing at something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Instead, God gave me daughters. He's looking at Lucie and Isabelle. They help Suzette hang clothes to dry. He smiles as he watches them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) But female werewolves are not born. They are made. And I chose my eldest. Lucie catches him watching. She waves. He waves back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another day. Cesaire is giving Lucie a stern lecture. Lucie's face is ashen and there are tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) When I finally decided to leave, I told Lucie the truth. And I gave her a choice. She could come with me. Or I would take you instead. Lucie turns and sees Isabelle approaching. We realize that we've seen this moment before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This doesn't concern you, Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Father. Isabelle walks away. Cesaire watches her go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) She agreed to come with me. She did it to protect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle is fast asleep. Lucie sneaks out of bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We arranged to meet on the night of the next full moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucie stands naked, arms clutched around her breasts. Then, a NOISE in the brush. She turns and sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was not a werewolf yet. I had to turn her. ... the Wolf emerge from the forest with a scrap of bloody meat dangling from its jaws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later. Lucie weeps as she forces herself to eat the raw meat scraps. The Wolf watches, panting... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) First, she had to eat human flesh. I fed her from a kill I had made the month before. But the ritual was not yet complete. She had to be bitten by a male werewolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle looks like she's going to be ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bite should have changed her. It should have made her like me. But it didn't. That's when I knew. There was no werewolf blood in her. I was not her father. I was so angry. I killed her before I even realized I was doing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire sits slumped in a corner, too drunk to move. A hand reaches in to help him. It's Isabelle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Afterwards, I thought about killing myself. The only thing that kept me alive was you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle helps drunk Cesaire into bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You were so beautiful. So kind. And I knew you were mine. That's why you could understand me when no one else could. You were mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cesaire takes Isabelle's hand and won't let it go. She backs into the wall. He looms over her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you see now? This is your heritage. This is what you are. Everything I have done has been to insure the future of our bloodline. We will run together (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: like my father and I once did. You are the next generation. You have had your first taste of human flesh. Now one bite from me is all that is needed to change you. It will only hurt for a moment. And then you will be as I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must indeed be a God. For you are surely the Devil...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will give you a choice. Come with me now. Or refuse me and let your friends suffer in your place. I will kill them one by one. Your mother. Roxanne. Peter. Isabelle shudders. She slowly pulls away and he releases her. She walks over to the table, her back to him. She eyes the ball of yarn with Grandmother's knitting needles in it. A long beat. Isabelle chokes back tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father...? He approaches her. Stands behind her and places his hand on her shoulder. Her skin crawls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, my dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave me two choices. She turns to face him. Looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I have thought of a third. Suddenly -- CRUNCH! Isabelle drives something hard into Cesaire's jaw. He gasps, choking. He puts his had to his throat. Blood spills out through his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandmother's ball of yarn on the table. The knitting needles aren't sticking out of it anymore... They're sticking out of Cesaire's neck. He falls to his knees, gagging. Then he flops over dead. Eyes open. Isabelle gazes down at him. She looks like she might have just lost her mind. Then she sits on the floor, staring at his body... and screams. An eruption of rage, betrayal, and heartbreak. She screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cottage is dark and quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pitch black in here. There's a KNOCK at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hello? No response. The door CREAKS open. It's Peter. As he opens the door, moonlight spills inside to reveal Isabelle huddled and trembling in the corner. She's screamed and cried herself out. All that's left is anger and a grim resolve. She did what she had to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Peter sit at the table. A dim candle provides the only light. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People should know what he was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't tell anyone. If they don't believe you, they'll hang you for this. And if they do believe you, they'll hang you for being the daughter of the Wolf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll run away. I was ready to run away last night. (BEAT) Why didn't you come for me? Peter gives her a long look. But instead of speaking, he rolls up his sleeve. Isabelle's eyes go wide. There's a huge scar on his arm. In the shape of a bite mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was bitten at the festival. I spent last night in the woods because I was afraid of what might happen... (A BEAT) I changed. I'm like him now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're not. You could never be like him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle's tears fall, the full implications of what he's saying starting to sink in. He takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't stay here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you can. We can still be together. My father lived here. My grandfather lived here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father and your grandfather killed people. They couldn't help themselves. If I stay here, I won't be able to control myself. (off her look) I have to be alone. Isabelle rests her head on his and they just sit like that, leaning against one another in the candlelight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Peter crouch next to Cesaire's body. The candle is on the floor, casting weird shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could take him to the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want him ever found.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll weight him with rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We'll put the rocks inside him. (off his look) Cut him open. I will sew the rocks inside him. Peter is taken aback. She's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter and Isabelle have placed several heavy rocks next to Cesaire's body. Peter opens Cesaire's shirt and takes out a hunting knife. Isabelle gives Peter a nod. Peter somewhat reluctantly lowers the knife, his shoulder moving up and down as he goes about his unseen task... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moments later, Isabelle threads a needle and coldly stitches begins stitching. We don't see what she's doing, but there's blood on her needle and thread. There's a spot of blood on her cheek, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Low mist hugs the ground. There's a wooden A-frame pontoon raft tied to a ferry dock. A guy-rope runs through the A-frame to a pier on the opposite shore. Isabelle and Peter nervously approach. He pushes a wheelbarrow onto the raft, its contents wrapped in burlap. Peter unties the moorings and is about to shove off, but Isabelle stops him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. She pulls back the burlap, revealing Cesaire's dead body. His belly is lumpy and misshapen, an ugly red line in his torso stitched together with black thread. The knitting needles still jut out of his jaw. Isabelle yanks them out, then pulls the burlap back over Cesaire's body. Peter gives her a questioning look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These belonged to my grandmother. The knitting needles are covered in blood. Peter takes out a rag and wipes the blood off for her. And as he does... something begins to shine through in the moonlight. Peter gives Isabelle a stunned look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're silver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter uses a long pole to push the raft across the water. Isabelle gazes out at the moonlit mist. They stop the in the middle of the river. They exchange a look... ... then each take a side of the wheelbarrow and dump the body into the water. It sinks instantly and is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death was too good for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can live with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Peter stand on the shore. He kisses her and she holds his face in her hands, wanting the kiss to last forever. When they part, she gives him an aching look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where will you go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I need to understand what I've become. Maybe I can learn to control it. (off her look) I'll take my own life before I take another's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not coming back. I don't want you to wait for me. This is the last time you'll ever see me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it isn't. You'll be in my dreams until the day I die. Peter turns and starts to walk away. But then he pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Henri is a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, he is. Then Peter continues on until he vanishes in the fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Isabelle as she watches him go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I never saw him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The leaves have returned to the forest with explosions of green. Crops grow in the fields. Flowers bloom. The village is vibrant with life and beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Life in my village was changed forever. There were many questions and few answers. In the (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) end, the Wolf did not return. And that was answer enough for most.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle and Henri stand before Father Auguste. They're getting married. Roxanne, Suzette, and other friends and neighbors watch as Isabelle and Henri exchange rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Henri and I were married. He was a good man and a good father. I loved him very much. But I never loved him the same way that I loved Peter. That was the one secret in our marriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle laughs as she watches Henri run around, playing with their three young children -- TWIN GIRLS and a BOY. Isabelle gives Henri a warm, loving smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I only tell you now because he is dead. And if he knows now, I believe that he forgives me, for he must also know that I never loved him falsely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle's Girls are in bed asleep. Isabelle enters, carrying the sleeping Boy. She gently places him in bed next to the girls and covers them with a blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is my story, not that I expect you will believe it. In my own village, the events of that awful winter have already passed into legend. Parents tell their children to be good or else the Wolf will come and gobble them up. Isabelle smiles as she watches them sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) They've already forgotten. A simple children's story is all that remains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isabelle opens the door and strolls outside, looking up at the sky. The moon is full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) But sometimes, when the moon is full, my thoughts still turn to Peter. He promised me that I would never see him again. And I never have. Somewhere, a wolf HOWLS. Isabelle smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) But I often wonder if I hear him.
direction.name: direction
